name: Hot Wheels 10 Car Pack (Styles May Vary)  (Amazon Exclusive)

reviews.review_text: Disappointed in the cars, most looked like they have paint chipping and wobbly wheels. My son was excited for cars but these feel cheap and not like most hot wheels. Definitely disappointed in quality.

I remember my first race track waaaaaaayyyy back in the `60`s, and all those cool cars. Our grandson kept saying he wanted a" race car track ", (he`s 3 now), so we set out looking for one. My wife had gotten him several Hot Wheels cars and he loved them. I remembered how tough they were with all my crash and bang back in my younger days, so we happened upon this set on Amazon. The price was good, there were all different models in the pack, so we ordered it. When he opened it , man was he excited! He started rolling them around really easily at first,... then the crashes, the smashes, the "big jumps" ahh to be a kid again. Well, he`s had them for over a month now, they`re still rolling along. It`s a pretty cool thing to watch your grand kids enjoy something that you remember from your childhood. As a matter of fact, I think I still have one or two of my old Hot Wheels from back then, I wonder if he wants race poppa?
perfect for my four yr old grandsons birthday, all he wanted to play with at the party

If your child loves cars, this is a great buy! Purchased this for my son for Christmas and he plays with it over and over and even likes to take some cars with him in his pocket when we go to different places.
reviews.review_header: this is a great buy! Purchased this for my son for Christmas ...

reviews.review_text: Exactly as described. It was worth purchasing.
Product was a big hit with my 4 year old nephew. He loved it.
was supposed to be a 10 count. came as a 9 count.... not happy!!!
Bo loves this!

name: Hot Wheels Monster Jam Tour Favorites – Styles May Vary

reviews.review_text: The trucks are fine and are just like what you see in the stores but my issue is with the seller. I understand that you can't choose the sets you want but when I order 3 sets and I get three of the same sets then it doesn't make sense.

Styles may vary... I REALLY wanted the set pictured (#3) as it contains trucks we don't already have. I received set #1 - containing (another) Grave Digger. Amazon won't exchange for what is considered the same item. I wish there was an ability to pick which set to purchase... I would have also bought set #2.

Was very excited to get these for my three boys and hold them back for Christmas, so I ordered three boxes. Tons of different pictures so was hoping to get different ones... Nope. Each box the exact same. I highly doubt this was "random order". If that's all you have, take down the other pictures so at least people know what they are buying.

The quality you'd expect from Hot Wheels all the way, and I love you get four for $20 so this can be a toy you can stretch out. For those "trucko" lovers in your life these will be invaluable. My youngest baby son is obsessed with trucks, automobiles, and any large vehicle sort of thing. I am unable to explain this fascination, but I am glad they have the toys to foster and nurture his interest. The trucks are well put together and can take crazy abuse. We even have a truck garage now that everyone fights over, and these work great with it. 80's kids will know that Hot Wheels are a solid buy no matter what, and it's still that way today. Would recommend!

We got these for my 3 year old son on his birthday. He loves them and rolls them around constantly. He is now more obsessed with monster trucks than ever and has even asked to sleep with them. He is like a bull in a china shop and destroys everything, either because he plays so rough or his curiosity wins out and he dismantles things. He has yet to break these, but time will tell if they can withstand him! So far so good though!
reviews.review_header: He is like a bull in a china shop and destroys everything

reviews.review_text: These are awesome trucks! They are very sturdy. My three and five year old boys throw them, crash them, hit them, etc. and they are holding up great. I don't think you can pick the specific truck designs that you get, but the four we received look great. They aren't particularly fancy, but we love them.

Bought for my 2.5 year old grandson...he loves the set, pull back feature a plus. The trucks are well made, and are in vibrant colors. They are a perfect size for little hands. They are all packaged in separate boxes with clear windows- nice for four separate gifts. I would have given this toy a 5 star review but the packaging it came in was very difficult to work with, the trucks are screwed into the cardboard and I had to go to the hardware store to buy the tiniest screwdriver set I’ve ever seen. There is no way around getting trucks out of packaging without a screwdriver. If you try to force without unscrewing you’ll damage toy. So there, nice toy, difficult packaging.
reviews.review_header: Really nice metal truck set, but.........

reviews.review_text: My son recently got into monster trucks, we're not sure how as we live in Hong Kong and there is no monster truck advertisement or goods here. The quality is as advertised and since it's made by Hot Wheels, not much to worry about. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because there are variety packs but you could never know which you bought so while I would order again (against my wifes' wishes) I'd be worried about getting a repeat of the same trucks.
reviews.review_header: My son recently got into monster trucks, we're not ...

name: Hot Wheels 100-Car, Rolling Storage Case with Retractable Handle

reviews.review_text: These cases are terrible. They do not hold the amount of cars they say they do, they have big spaces in the middle (for monster jam trucks) but they will not reasonably holds standard cars. The standard car slots have a space under the middle of the car, so that only the wheels are supported. This leads to the cars falling sideways down through the middle of the rows on top of each other. I found a "thread organizer" that actually fits 48 cars securely. It is a clear case with double sided lids. I got some hotwheels logo stickers and put on them. They're perfect.

I was a little iffy ordering this since there were a lot of negative reviews, but so glad we did. Well made plenty of room for cars. Yes you can fit 100 cars in there we actually got more than that in our case. There are different sized compartments and some spaces require smaller cars, while others you can put large trucks or several cars in a slot. Not a lot of options out there to store large quantities of HotWheels. My son loves this rolling case. I don't love the way it snaps inside to separate the each side, it is a little hard for my 5 year old to open. The reason for the 4 stars. Overall extremely impressed with this case and got it at a great price.

This is the second car carry case I have bought for my 3 year old son. I got it because it looked durable and like it could hold a lot of cars. First of all, The latch at the top is hard to close, even for me. There is almost no way he could secure it by himself. Both the front and the back of the case hold cars and you have to secure a plastic screen on the one side before you close it so the cars on that side don't fall out. Again, no way my son could do this on his own. After a few months the hinge on the bottom broke and now it constantly falls apart. Finally, the Disney Cars cars do not fit in the individual slots, nor do some of the hot wheels cars. There are larger compartments to fit larger cars. Overall, it doesn't hold the number of cars I thought it would.

I was disappointed the hot wheels put their name on this product. My little guy LOVES his little hot wheels cars so bought this for him to keep his cars in. Very very poor quality. The latch on the top doesn't latch or stay closed, just overall poor quality for a "hotwheels" product. I think they should remove their name from the product. Obviously, no one tested this product prior to putting this as a hot wheels product, if they did, shame on them. total waste of money
reviews.review_header: waste of money, don't buy it

reviews.review_text: It is VERY hard for an adult, much less a kid, to open and close this thing without all the cars falling out all over the place. It seems like it will be so cute and you will be so happy to have some cars organized. But it's not that great. The "100" cars thing is misleading - there aren't 100 actual slots. Some slots are bigger than others and fit multiple cars. So maybe it fits more than 100, but I would personally rather see one car per slot and that way it would be easier for my four year old to use it. Top latch that holds the whole thing shut isn't that sturdy and I'm sure if my son used it more it would be broken already.
reviews.review_header: Cars fall out easily when opening and closing

reviews.review_text: It's about the size of a very small piece of carry on luggage. They advertise 100 car capacity, but you are more likely to fit 50-60 in there. It's a pretty nice case on the outside with a retractable handle and nice wheels that roll easily. It stays closed and looks great. On the inside however the design to hold cars was not well thought out at all. They basically want you to stack 2-3 cars on top of each other to squeeze them in the spaces that are just not properly sized for Matchbox or HotWheels vehicles. It's ok for my toddler, but all of the cars and trucks are going to end up scratched up. There is a center divider that is supposed to keep the cars from falling out when you open the case, but it fails every time and the cars all fall out everywhere. I know there are not a lot of choices in cases for these cars, and this one is the largest but it really isn't the best choice.
reviews.review_header: It only holds 50-60 cars and they end up in a pile in the bottom of the case and fall everywhere when you open it.

reviews.review_text: My son loves his little car case and so do I. It is adorable! The only reason I give it 3 stars instead of 5 is because I feel the handle really should be designed to carry the weight of 100 Hot Wheels cars. This handle is made out of soft plastic instead of something metal and bends under the weight and it is only a short time before it will break, I'm sure. On the inside there is a cover that latches over one half of the case holding the cars stored in that compartment in place. On the other half of the case there is no cover so whenever the case is opened, by my son or any adult, most of the cars stored on that side come spilling out. I wish there was a cover for that half as well. Other than that, we love the case and this particular seller was great!

Bought this for my 3½ year old nephew. The biggest annoyance and the reason only 3 stars, is how difficult it is to pack - even for an adult! Securing the inner plastic flap is not an intuitive process and could not be accomplished at all by the child. Can't count the number of times the adults tried to close the case only to have the cars tumble out! Once packed and closed, however, it stored bunches of his favorite cars and was easy for him to take to Nana's and back.

name: Hot Wheels Basic Car 50-Pack (Packaging May Vary)

reviews.review_text: five stars

My son is turning 3 and i got this for his birthday. I took a peek because some reviews thought they were fake Hot Wheels. Mine are definately real! We have an assortment of standard cars and a handful of unique like the Scooby Mystery van, Jetsons car, a Minecraft car, a canon, a tank, a helicopter.... i am debating whether to wrap the box or wrap individually. The cards they come on are a little shorter than the individual ones you buy in the store. That doesnt matter to me but thought it might if you are a collector. Overall, for $32 I got 50 unique cars, no duplicates. I am assuming I will have a very happy toddler. Now i just need to find a container for them. The box it comes in is noce but just a cardboard box and i dont think it would hold up long for a toddler.

Hot wheels have always been a quality toy for any age, though nothing is like the ones from the 80's back. I ordered 2 of these for my 3 year old for Christmas over a year ago. Packaging was standard, everything was great. The problem was i ordered them together and i got duplicate packs. So this year he put his duplicates, which he played with and enjoyed, up for sale. He made $35 and i took him to a little shop i found that stills sells them 2 for a buck still in the package. He made a killing. He'll be 5 in May. Bottom line: if you order multiple packages, space them out.

I'm a teacher at a preschool and my boys (sometimes the girls) love their hot wheels cars. This pack is amazing and it gives you a wonderful variety. I never put more than one 20 cars out for them to play with at a time, so this pack allows me to mix it up every couple of weeks or wait for some to break (which none have yet) and just easily replace them. I also have to keep the box on a top shelf because the boys want me to open up a new car everyday. A great buy!

This is a great set of cars, which I paid $39.99 for, in Dec 2014 after a $10 price drop from the usual retail price of $49.99 (which you can find for a few dollars more at just about any retail store or online). The cars are individually packaged, which is nice, because you can hand each car out as a present. Of course, there is a nice variety of cars. My son loves these cars and so far none have broken, even through they get tossed around on a daily basis! If you can get them at this price, it's a great deal! If not, keep in mind that single cars sell for $1 each at most retail stores!

My kids are so happy ! I bought the step2 hot wheels coaster and needed cars for the race trace part . These exceeded my expectations . Some have steel chassi . Made in Malaysia. We got 2018 series and my 6yr old was over the moon .my 3 yr old enjoyed the variety . No duplicates . One package cake damaged but not a big deal : a dollar a car is what it came out . I’d recommend

I bought these as valentines for my sons class but honestly they were all so cool I wanted my boys to keep them all. Really unique assortment of cars and unique vehicles from TV shows and even a minecraft mine- car, Really cool and all individually packaged. Would highly recommend as party favors or for any collector. My assortment was different from other reviewer as was the box not the cool looking metal look but fine nonetheless. Great assortment at a great price!

GREAT pack of cars! We got a really good variety, some classic cars, a few trucks, some bigger vehicles, vans, movie cars, glow in the dark cars, even a yellow submarine. My kids have been playing with them non-stop. They are actual die cast cars, sometimes with a few plastic pieces but mostly the durable Hot Wheels that I am used to. They also come individually packaged inside the big box, so you can use them for gifts a few at a time if you want. We used some of them as treats to help potty train my twins, some for "just because" gifts, and saved some for gifts later. We are very happy with this purchase, and will probably get another box of these for Christmas!
reviews.review_header: This is a great big box of awesomeness!

name: Hot Wheels 9-Car Gift Pack (Styles May Vary)

reviews.review_text: Got a sweet pack full of race cars, classic cars, futuristic looking cars, and even an off road type vehicle. Love every car and for 10 bucks shipped? Easy buy.
reviews.review_header: Cool Hot Wheels for a cheap price.

reviews.review_text: My son is absolutely enthralled with the die cast cars and I chose this pack for him for Christmas. True to form, the Hot Wheels cars in this multipack are brightly colored, very diverse, always move freely when he "races" them across the floor, and so durable. He was thrilled to find such unique and fun designs and colors in this pack and I couldn't have been happier with the price and quality of the merchandise. Not even after days upon days of almost constant play has even one of these small cars shown any wear and tear nor have they broken in any way. I am very happy to see a good quality product still exists these days and I will be purchasing more for him soon. Even the package was in pristine condition and he still uses the plastic tray to "garage" his cars at night. Wonderful item, as expected.
reviews.review_header: Hot Wheels never fail to satisfy.

reviews.review_text: Beautiful sets
reviews.review_header: I bought my son these sets. He was pleased!

reviews.review_text: my son loves them!! he has been playing with them non stop...

The four year old loves these cars. They're well made and nearly indestructible, a necessity when letting a four year old use them as you never know if they are cars or projectiles. I've not seen any damage to any of them, and believe me, they've been tested.

I grew up playing with Hot Wheels back in the late 60's and early 70's and always loved them as a child and while these aren't as good as the old red line wheeled versions of my youth they are pretty decent. I bought this pack for my autistic son to take to his school. His former teacher left behind some kind of a track and a few cars but this will give the kids a bit more variety. Very nice for the money they cost.

Got this as a gift for my 4yo. We put together 3 separate shown designs, building them was pretty fun and not overly complicated, though it's worth noting you wont be able to rebuild them for very long given the cheap plastic tabs that hold them together. The launcher didn't really get the cars around the loops, because again the loops were just too cheap. When my kid wasn't able to I messed around with it for a while myself and found that no matter how hard or light I hit the launcher the plastic just wasn't built to guide the cars around. We sent it back, which is hard to do for a birthday present but we'll pick something else up for him in store.
reviews.review_header: Cheap, doesn't really work with configurations even with provided car

reviews.review_text: I bought this pack during the holiday season and used the cars for my daughter's advent calendar. She loved collecting them and the price was so affordable. I think it would make a fun birthday gift too when paired with a track set.
reviews.review_header: Surprise collection at an affordable price.

name: Matchbox 9-Car Gift Pack (Styles May Vary)

reviews.review_text: This is a great little gift set at a reasonable price. It comes with 9 matchbox cars in various styles. The set I received included a train, police boat, race cars, bull dozers, and construction trucks. Each set comes with an exclusive vehicle. Ours was a fire truck. They appear to be plastic, but the overall quality is decent. If your kid loves playing with cars, he or she will love this. One thing to note though is that the styles are chosen at random so you don't know what you'll get. I ordered two sets and received the same exact one for both. Luckily I bought these for two different boys in different households so it wasn't an issue for me. But just something to keep in mind.

I'm pretty careful to not buy things on Amazon that you can't return but made an exception in this case. I've learned my lesson and won't make that choice again. I understood that I might not get the ones shown in the pictures, but based on other reviews and the cool cars featured in the pictures, I thought I'd get some cool cars no matter what. I was wrong. While the cars pictured are neat, feature a lot of detailing and bright colors, the package I got contained a really bland set of cars - no detailing; mostly dark/muted colors, and while it might say "metal parts" on the box, there is little metal to most of the cars I got. Even the "featured" truck that I received is mostly plastic. Beyond disappointed with the actual cars! The other annoying part is that I ordered 2 sets, wanting one for each of my boys - 3 and almost 5. And, I got 2 of the same awful set. Why would I want 2 of the same set? So of course, as I know, I can't return them. I should have stuck to picking up cars for a dollar at the grocery store - at least then, I know what I'm getting. As for the rating, I considered giving it 2 stars, but couldn't pick anything I actually liked about the set, thus the 1-star review. Photos - Full Set; Bulldozer picture - tread doesn't move - cheap plastic part, there are little wheels underneath that allow it to move; Bland green car - no details; Boring SUV - I guess it's a Range Rover, but I never would have guessed that if it didn't say that; Torque Titan - ugly brown truck, mostly or maybe all plastic
reviews.review_header: Do Not Recommend - Poor quality, bland set, same set if you order , No returns

reviews.review_text: I am giving these 2 stars. I knew style varied from the description. I ordered 2 boxes; one for my son and one for nephew as an Eid gift. One set was okay...had a SWAT vehicle that I thought was cool...but the other one was awful (and looks cheap). It didn't have even 1 'ooh' car. Can go to the dollar store and buy what you want so with similar pricing for a random assortment I would at least expect each pack to have at least 1 nice car. Now I am not sure what to do...the kids fight over cars so I have a feeling if I give that the kid with the bad pack will be fighting for the cars in the other pack. They like police cars , taxi's and school buses a lot so I was hoping to get these...or the helicopter as shown. My son would even settle for a regular bus but neither pack had. I gave this 2 stars originally but I have updated it to 1 star. I ended up ordering 3 more sets in hopes that one of them would be a good set...better than the one I wanted to replace from the first order. Instead I got 3 duplicate sets...also the same exact set as the one I wanted to replace. Frustrating to say the least. 5 sets of cars and 4 of them the exact same?? Worst part is it is a junk set...no good cars in it. I won't dare trying a third time. Now I have to figure out a different gift bcs I can't count on Amazon
reviews.review_header: Better to go the the Dollar Tree; Not worth the price for what you get on Amazon

reviews.review_text: We received a set that is different from any of the four sets shown in the pictures. It's okay, just not the style I expected.
reviews.review_header: Style not as shown in pictures

reviews.review_text: I purchased this product via Prime shipping and received it in 2 days packaged in a small shipment box- very easy to open. The set includes 9 different Matchbox cars/trucks. I purchased this set as a gift for my 4 year old nephew and he loved them. He immediately opened them and started playing them- this was my first Matchbox purchase and I was very happy with the quality of the cars/trucks. To my surprise my 19 month old daughter loved them also so I will be purchasing another set for her in the near future. I definitely give this product 5 stars. Thanks for making such a great product!

I would give it 5 stars if they actually let you know which style are you gonna get. I bought it to teach my daughter about different types of cars/trucks and I got 9 cars and one boat. I think it is best if they make a one package that has different kinds on it, maybe increase the price a little if they have to. Maybe someone here knows a brand that sells different kinds of automobiles in one package? That would be great and be very helpful.
reviews.review_header: Styles may vary, means you wouldn't get the one in the picture.

reviews.review_text: I purchased this for a 3 year old boy for his birthday and he couldn't be happier! A little boy can never have too many cars right?! He was excited to see so many cars and did not want to put it down after he opened it. It comes with 9 different cars. This is an inexpensive gift but an exciting gift for any little boy or girl who loves to play with cars. Even my 3 year old girl would love to have this as a gift! Great deal for this car set! Perfect for a birthday or Christmas present.

After exclusively using hot wheels my entire childhood, what a sweet surprise it was to discover matchbox cars with my son in Target one day. My first impression was that (within the same price range) matchbox cars are much much better built that their hot wheels counterparts, although both matchbox and hot wheels are from the same parent company. Hot wheels are mostly focused on creating fantasy versions of various race cars... and these fantasies do run extremely wild with some models. Matchbox cars are mostly miniature replicas of real world vehicles, plus construction vehicles plus fantasy versions of these construction vehicles. To give you another example.... hot wheels mostly look like various versions of a bat-mobile and matchbox look like various versions of an army truck. Also, I feel that hot wheels cars drift better while matchbox cars travel straighter and hence more suitable for playing car smash :)

name: Hot Wheels Marvel Avengers Die-Cast Vehicle, 5-Pack (Amazon Exclusive)

reviews.review_text: I meant for these to be a Christmas gift and opened the outer box within eyesight of my 4 year old by mistake. At that point, there was no going back. These are well-made Hot Wheels cars with a theme. My 2 and 4 year old love them and raced them around the house all night. Hawkeye is more difficult for them to recognize, but it's a nice addition to the set.

Cute. Grandson loved them. They are just a bit larger than matchbox cars. They seemed a bit pricey since you can get a regular matchbox or hotwheel car for $1, but these do seem to be a bit heavier and well built, and of course, they are the Avengers, so Grandson loved them.

My son is 3 years and 8 months old and he is at that age where he loves cars. He can identify which super hero belongs to which car. I would be cautious with this if you have younger children as there are small parts on the vehicles which can come undone. So far they are holding up very well to his use. It arrived on time and everything was perfect.
reviews.review_header: Durable but not meant for younger children

reviews.review_text: My 4 year old son hasn't put these down since he got them two weeks ago. He even sleeps with them. I must say they have also put up with some pretty bad abuse, my nephew threw one at a moving car that ran over it n it's still looks like it's in mint condition.

My daughter loves bath toys but all bath toys are for babies and as she reminds me many times, not just babies like to play in the bath!! Six months later, not even one rust mark ANYWHERE. Highly recommended.
Gave as a gift for a 3rd birthday. Great for playing with or anyone who collects hot wheels or marvel toys.
Our grandson loved these cars! The only reason I gave a 4 instead of 5 is because two of the cars are too large to use on his Hot Wheels track.
reviews.review_header: Great for Avenger fans who like Hot Wheels

reviews.review_text: Bought as a gift for a friends son who loves all things avengers, my son saw it and wanted to play it. Cars are the size of regular hot wheel cars

name: Hot Wheels Super Speed Blastway Track Set

reviews.review_text: I have purchased sets like this in the past and only one person in the family is able to operate (eg: there’s a loop and you need to slam the launch pad just so in order to get it to clear the loop). This is not the case here: 2.5 year old is able to successfully operate and he loves it. The flags popping up in the back adds and extra element of fun. Also nice that two kids can play at the same time to race cars. Lighter weight non-chunky cars seem to race best. It comes with one car. Price online was much cheaper than the price on similar sets in store. I actually couldn’t find this in store. Would buy for a friend’s kids in the future.
reviews.review_header: Even a 2.5 year old can do it!

reviews.review_text: Santa brought this for our 4 year old and its been one of his "go to" toys ever since. Be creative. We typically don't set it up like Hot Wheels intended. We add tracks and create our own jumps and send cars all over the place. Its a blast. The 9 year old girl and mom love it too. We haven't found too many cars that wont work with it. Excellent value.

Its a good toy the kids love it. Pros: Easy to put together Engages kids they play for a long time Cons: It's LOUD you have to bang down to launch the cars, it's LOUD! The thing that pops out will get lost easily Overall: Its worth it since the kids love it and it can be used with other track systems to expand tracks. there is also a way to bypass the turn which is cool so you can use this as just a launcher.
reviews.review_header: Its a good toy the kids love it

reviews.review_text: We got this for our youngest grandson who is just getting into Hot Wheels. He really enjoyed it. Just make sure to get another small car for racing. It only comes with one.

This product was under 25$ ap that right there is an extra star. My first rodeo with hot wheels. I struggled to put this together, until I realized the instructions I was looking at were for some other expansion on this piece. Found proper instructions, got item up and going, my son (2yrs) loves it. It only comes with one car is crappy for a track meant to race two cars, but luckily we had another car around. My biggest complaint is as you race the cars, things pop off at the top of the track to kinda show who won. These things are always popping up on their own, or worse, not popping up when they are meant too. Overall though, 20 bucks, it's loud and moves and has cars so we are happy

Got this race way for grandsons ( I also bought a 50 pc set of hot wheels to go with). My niece put it together in a just a few minutes. You "hit" the posts on the end and they race around and pieces on the other end pop off. I think they are going to love it. I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

I purchased for my 4 year old nephew for his birthday. He loves playing with it. He was rough with it, making the cars fly way past the top, which was great fun for him (not so much for his parents). Just know that not all hot wheels cars will work with it. The cars provided obviously do, but my nephew had received other cars that he tried to "race". They would get stuck on the track. Use the cars provided and it works great.
reviews.review_header: Can take rough handling from 4 year old

reviews.review_text: My 4 year old and surpingsly 1 year old love this toy. The only thing that is very annoying about it is you constantly have to re-attach the Orange track because it comes loose at the connection point. Pretty flimsy for the price.
reviews.review_header: My 4 year old and surpingsly 1 year old love this toy

name: Hot Wheels City Blastin' Rig

reviews.review_text: Bought this for our 4 year old. It's a great truck; very sturdy and doesn't feel like it will break despite the abuse he's given it over the past few weeks. It comes with three cars and you can load a bunch more on the bottom row and more on the top. Not all Hot Wheel and Matchbox cars will fit as once in a while we run into a car that is a little too wide; the 'tracks' on the truck seem just slightly smaller than the orange race tracks. The cars on the bottom rows will shoot out the front of the truck. This action isn't exactly precise and sometimes the cars come flying out and sometimes the kind of roll out a little early when you pull the launching button back, but it's still fun. Again, some cars do better than others. Aside from the size requirement, we discovered that convertibles and other cars with lots of jagged top portions tend to get stuck so we avoid launching those. The from part of the truck has to be pushed all the way back and snapped into the trailer for the cars to launch, and in this configuration it won't move side to side. But if you pull the front part forward it will easily move side to side. If you look at the pictures this will make more sense. I will say that although I thought the launching function would be the coolest part, my son actually prefers just driving it around and loading cars onto it. He uses the launching function only occasionally. Overall, a great purchase and easily worth the price.

Got this transporter truck for my nephew's fourth birthday. He is all about hot wheels and thought he would be over the moon with this. As he unwrapped the gift he could not contain his excitement and immediately had to load up the transporter with cars. It fits a lot of cars. Of course he was excited about shooting the cars out the front but the trigger would get jammed and he needed help wriggling it back into place. So just some notice to those purchasing for the younger end of the age range- they may have some difficult operating independently. For the price I'd expect the trigger to not jam right out of the box.

This truck was good for about 24 hours before it broke. The piece where the front of the truck attaches to the back where the cars go broke. It now will not shoot the cars out. The trigger to shoot the cars was always a little spotty. I could barely figure it out so I had 3 other adults do it and they still had to put some muscle into it. My 3-year-old loves cars and lived this but an adult was the k Lu one who could get the cars to shoot out. Only reason I'm giving it 2 stars still is because my little guy still lives it and plays with it regardless of it being broken.

This item was bought for my 2 year old grandson. He loves cars and this gives him something else to use to interact with his hot wheel cars. He gravitates to this toy when he visits, I only wish it was a little sturdier. I don't think it will last very long.

My 3 year old loves this toy, but it's cheap, thin plastic and gets jammed easily. The front comes off and won't hold together well when you want it to. It's always giving him trouble and he's continually bringing it to me to fix it, but he still has tons of fun with it.
Bought this for our 3 year old grandson for Christmas. He loves it. Nicely built and holds a lot of cars. Well worth the money spent on it!!

This thing is awesome! My son loves it! He has had this toy for about 9 months now, and he still plays with it daily. At the age of 2 and a half, he was able to operate this truck without assistance from anyone. While the cars shoot out of the rig on carpet, it works best on either tile or hard wood. The other thing that really gives this toy longevity is that it works with all hot wheels which we can pick up at our local grocery for under a dollar.
reviews.review_header: This thing is awesome! My son loves it

reviews.review_text: The front of the truck can be a bit of a hassle attaching the front on when being played with but aside from that this toy is pretty awesome. Definitely my sons favorite toy out of all his others. The cars don’t shoot out very far but that’s not a bad thing. It keeps me from being lost under the sofa and such all the time

name: Hot Wheels Mega Hauler Truck

reviews.review_text: I bought this for my son who has collected many Hot Wheels and the cars were laying around the house everywhere as he found it no fun to store it in the collector's display cases. With this truck, not only does he have lots of fun playing with it but also naturally cleans up the cars laying around the home into a neat truck that carries at least fifty Hot Wheels cars. A very nice concept - fun and practical!
reviews.review_header: Great toy for kids who love Hot Wheels.

reviews.review_text: My 4 year old son has put this thing to the test over the past 4 months since he received it for Christmas '15. I bought the 9 car gift pack to go with it. It's still not broken which is saying a lot since I have a 4 year old and 7 year old boy who destroy a lot of toys because they like to smash them into things. Hot Wheels 9-Car Gift Pack (Styles May Vary)
reviews.review_header: It's still not broken which is saying a lot since I have a 4 year old and 7 year old boy who destroy a lot of toys because they

reviews.review_text: My son has tons of hotwheels cars so we thought this would make a pretty good addition to his collection. He does like it, but barely uses it. He gets frustrated because he loads it up with cars, but as soon as it turns the wrong way or bumps anything the cars fall all over the place. I can't say I blame him, I have also loaded it up and tried to move it and next thing the cars are everywhere.
reviews.review_header: Not as functional as it could be.

reviews.review_text: This is a great buy if you know what you're getting. My son and I manage to fit 56 Hot Wheels and a few Matchbox cars in this behemoth. See the pictures! When fully loaded the trailer isn't going too go far, its far too heavy and if you topple it over the cars will spill out. This is a storage unit NOT a transport unit. My son pushes it around the house a bit but it gets more use after play time, again as a storage unit. The extension of the top shelves is nice. Overly wide or tall car will have to fit on the top.
reviews.review_header: Great STORAGE trailer. It's not a transporter.

reviews.review_text: My son loves trucks that carry cars, and he would see this one at Toys 'r' Us and Target all the time and play with it on the shelf. The problem was that it was a bit expensive for what it was. At TRU it was $20, and at Target it was $14, still a bit pricey for this, I felt, considering it doesn't come with any cars to carry. But at the wonderful price of $9.96 that Amazon was offering it for, I was able to grab it for Christmas! My son will be thrilled.
reviews.review_header: My son loves this truck, and the price was right!

reviews.review_text: My grandson has had a blast with this mega hauler. He can load a bunch of cars on it to "drive" them somewhere. He just has to remember to engage the stop or once he starts pushing the hauler all the cars fall off the back. I think it's funny when he forgets- he does not :) Downed 1 star because, of course, it's all plastic. We've already had 2 pieces break off - didn't affect functionality and it's still usable, but don't expect it to last long.
My grandson love's the hauler. Really well built stands up to a 4 year old wonderfully. Easy for little fingers to get the cars on and moves easily

My two year old grand son really likes this! It is not very heavy material, but it seems to be holding up well. It is easy enough to maneuver and stack cars...even for a little one that just turned two.
reviews.review_header: Great truck for storage and play

name: Hot Wheels Spin Storm Playset (Amazon Exclusive)

reviews.review_text: I thought this would be a great toy to get some more play out of all of the hotwheel cars we already have in our household. I'll start off by saying that my kids (7&5) are having fun with this toy so far and it has provided a couple of hours of entertainment for sure. But I have to give it 1 star only -- having tested it with about 20 different cars, only 1 or 2 cars can make a complete loop on 1 of the 2 loops, and on the other loop almost no cars can complete the loop (they either fly off or fall off, even the car that was included in the kit), so we have not been able to really enjoy the "crashing" element of this toy. So I think that the kids are going to become quickly bored of it. As other reviewers have mentioned, that is basically the only function as it does not easily allow for customization or other configurations. Aside from that I think that I agree with other reviewers that it wasn't too hard to put together, although I did it instead of the kids. Overall I am thinking about returning it for a refund. I'm also disappointed in the other earlier reviewers who generally all gave it high marks, but they are almost all out of the "vine" program where they are sent the product for free in exchange for a review. Going forward I will be reading those reviews with a much more skeptical eye and I would remind those vine reviewers to please give us a true unbiased view of the product. Please help those of us out who are spending are hard earned $ to buy these items.
reviews.review_header: Be warned...does not work as intended. Suggest looking for other alternatives.

reviews.review_text: My boys want to love Hot Wheels tracks and they love seeing other kids play with them, so Santa brought this one. However, since Christmas my two and five year old have only played with it a handful of times. It looks like so much fun on TV or in the store, but when you set it up, how many times can you really watch a car go around and around? Sometimes they will get creative and set up dominoes at the end of the track to see who can knock down the most with their cars, or they will include this in another track they make themselves, but most of the time it goes un-played with.
reviews.review_header: Looks Cool- but doesn't hold their interest

reviews.review_text: This is my five year old's favorite toy for weeks now. It has given him hours and hours of enjoyment and he hasn't gotten tired of it yet. Every chance he gets, he is playing with this toy. This is the first toy he really has ever had that he hasn't gotten bored of and put aside for awhile within a few hours to few days. I can't believe it but it's probably been our best toy investment or purchase for him ever. The cars don't crash that much as advertised, but honestly that really doesn't matter that much at all to my son. He really enjoys seeing how many he can get on the track at the same time and launching them around the loops going as fast a rate of speed as possible. The track is very, very fast for a toy car track. When the cars do crash occasionally, it's a fun surprise and change of pace for him. Most of the time though, it's just him just launching and re loading the toy cars and having them do loops at a very, very fast speed for toy cars and that's entertaining and enjoyable enough for him. I can't blame him, it's can be surprisingly addictive for the whole family when we join in too and make a game of counting how many we are launching at one time until they crash and all derail of the tracks. The Spin Storm has ended up being much more fun overall and getting far more use than his toy train table! I would caution that the Spin Storm is pretty loud unfortunately, louder than I expected it would be. This could grate on you if your child is playing it for long periods of time. We've learned to live with it since he loves it so much, though.
reviews.review_header: This is my five year old's favorite toy for weeks now

reviews.review_text: Great toy. My 3 year old grandson loves it. It is a bit noisy. Good batteries last a long time. You can add extra track and the cars will ride forever on it. My only complaint is that a lot of the Hot Wheel cars won't ride this track. The description does say this but I was surprised at how many do not. Still - a great buy!
reviews.review_header: Great toy. My 3 year old grandson loves it

reviews.review_text: 2 stars because my kids have fun with it but it eats through the D batteries like crazy!!! Moderate use for less than a week and it's requiring the batteries to be changed constantly. I thought the toy itself was a little bit pricey. Turns out I'm spending more just for it to be played with.

I bought this track from amazon due to its GREAT price. I bought it for my 4 year old son and I must confess, I was excited to play with it myself. This thing is amazingly fast. It remains on the track for as many times as you continue to run the launching motor unless the hot wheel cars crash on a cross lane. (Absolutely Fun).. One thing that is worth mentioning is that the track as a notch that you can actually open so that the cars can exit the loop faze and enter into another part of the track that you can add.

This was another MOST WANTED toy, once it was opened the kids played and played with it. They have had so much fun crashing the cars in the loop. It is a bit noisy once they start running it, but if it is in the other room it is not a problem. If I am not mistaken it only comes with 1 car, so we had purchased a set to go with it. This was a winner :) This is a link to the cars we also purchased Hot Wheels 9-Car Gift Pack (Styles May Vary) Hot Wheels 9-Car Gift Pack (Styles May Vary)
reviews.review_header: They have had so much fun crashing the cars in the loop

reviews.review_text: This was a Christmas present for my nephew. My dad and I set it up and played with it more than he did! You can add several cars at a time and wait to see which one crashes first. Note, you can't easily take it apart once it's put together so be sure you don't need to move it from your parents' house to your sister's after it's assembled!
reviews.review_header: you can't easily take it apart once it's put together so be ...

name: Hot Wheels Workshop Track Builder Starter Kit (Amazon Exclusive)

reviews.review_text: My son got this as a birthday gift. We went purely by the other reviews and could not be happier. This is a fun set. Easy to assemble and highly entertaining. The race track and cars work really well and don't get stuck. The only negative was that it comes with only one car. But for the price, it is worth it I guess. The other normal hot wheels didn't race as smoothly as the one that came with it. Will have to look for ones that go together with this.

I bought this starter track for my two grandsons age 4 and 2. I also bought a set of the straight pieces. They have spent lots of hours playing and racing cars. This is a great set and has diagrams of how to put together different set ups. I have sat on the floor and played with them. They love it!

I purchased this for my 7-yr old son's birthday and he loves it. Even with the relatively short track he enjoys playing and traying to create new tracks with other Hot Wheels track he has. It is good as starting kit, of course you may need to spend some more money to create longer and more exciting tracks. You know how fast kids get bored of their toys :-) Item was delivery in a timely fashion using Prime benefits and packaging was good.
reviews.review_header: My 7-yr old son loves this Hot Wheels track

reviews.review_text: When the grandkids ages 9 and 6 visit, they love working together to build the track with loop. This set is just the right size for now, but we will probably add to it once they become bored with it. It works great when put together properly and sometimes it doesn't when one of the pieces isn't connected quite right. But that is actually part of the fun, trying to diagnose what went wrong. Not all cars work with the track, but they also enjoyed experimenting to see which of their collection works and which do not. A lot of fun for the money, and I'd say it also helped to encourage teamwork, patience and problem solving skills.
reviews.review_header: A big hit with the grandkids!

reviews.review_text: AWESOME! My 10-year old has almost moved on from Hot Wheels, but this has reignited his love for them. He's had fun building different tracks.

Not a ton of track, so best to order a set of additional track pieces. The launchers are operated by rubber bands, but barely have enough power to get a car thru the loop and across another foot or so of track. Could use bigger bands...
reviews.review_header: Good, but not a ton of launch power

reviews.review_text: Already logged about 3hrs on this with a 3.5yo. Held his attention and made him squeal a few times. We had a booster from a previous set. Had to secure the loop down with some heavy books. Reduced energy loss. The start pads that shoot the cars with a rubber band work sometimes.
reviews.review_header: Already logged about 3hrs on this with a 3. ...

reviews.review_text: This was for my grandson's Christmas. We gave up on on all the crazy configurations of this set and the others from this collection. None of them work well.
reviews.review_header: This was for my grandson's Christmas. We gave up ...

name: Hot Wheels Criss Cross Crash Track Set (Amazon Exclusive)

reviews.review_text: I read the reviews. For the people who complained about cars not staying on, you didn't follow the instructions carefully. When I first put it together, I slightly followed them, but was sure "I had it" when I just attached the tracks. When the cars wouldn't stay on, and yet they did when someone else had previously put it together, I realized it does in fact matter where each track is attached. So follow the instructions carefully. Otherwise, awesome toy. My 4.5 year old loves it. We keep it out for awhile and then we take it apart and put it away for awhile. It is like having a new toy when we pull it out again. Have fun!
reviews.review_header: Cars won't fall off if you follow the Instructions

reviews.review_text: This is a fun if somewhat loud toy. Both my son and daughter really enjoyed playing with it. So why the two stars? Well the design of this track has 4 little plastic pieces that are used to attach the braces that hold up the track to the track. Four little separate pieces. We lost one little piece about 6 weeks after getting this track and now the entire thing is useless. I searched online to find replacement pieces with no luck. I contacted the company to inquire about purchasing a pack of these little plastic pieces and was informed that they're not available. What? Really? I can't buy replacement pieces for this track that are essential for its use? No I can't. Obviously it's on us that the piece was lost. But my children are 7 and 4. Everything gets lost. I think it's bad design and planning to have little pieces that are essential but not replaceable. So we have this new track that is completely useless. My children are disappointed and so am I.

I didn't have high expectations but Wow! If set up level, with supports centered, this thing really works! Got it for 2 granddaughters, ages 2 and 4. They are able to easily feed cars onto the track and are thrilled by the numbers of loops they can get before they jymp track. They are not into the crash aspect, but instead keep track of which cars go longer or faster. I once counted 64 full laps before a car jumped track! Now, sometimes they jump track after 1 loop, but there are enough "long rides" to make my little girls squeal in delight! Thousand of loops are on the 1st set of batteries too!

Wish it did more. Kind of like a passing fancy. First off - I'd recommend a normal hot wheels playset - something with more features or neat track pieces for cars. It does do what it says - the cars are propelled forward into the loop by a set of sideways spinning wheels. And the car will continue going loop to loop to loop to loop forever, if it doesn't crash into another car. Only some cars will work due to wheelbase, center of gravity, size. So, be sure you have at least 6+ cars available to try; go for lower-body sporty cars. IT IS LOUD! The motor is LOUD, the cars are LOUD when they roll on the track loops, and LOUD when they crash. It's fun for kids though - to see the cars crash. You have to be careful not to get your finger smashed between two crashing cars - if you quickly put cars on the track while it's operating. But, it has an "entry ramp" for the cars to drive down just before they get to the spinning wheels. We had more fun with it by removing the one loop near the wheels - so the wheels would shoot the car down a long track (sold separately as many straight track pieces) which we just connected easily.
reviews.review_header: Does what it should - makes cars go around the loops. It is LOUD.

reviews.review_text: I bought this for my son who just turned 4 as a birthday gift. I was a little apprehensive when reading other comments and this being our very first Hot Wheels track, but I'm happy to say my little guy loves this. He will sit and play with this for countless amounts of time. The cars do tend to crash together and fly off as others mentioned, but that is what the toy is meant to do. I think for my son that is the best part! He squeals with delight when they crash and he gets to pick them up and put them back in the track. Super exciting & fun!

I had a hard time choosing something to entertain my 6 year old grandson while he and his family were visiting for Thanksgiving. I am SOOO glad I chose this track set! It was exciting for him to get such a big box gift, of course. But the excitement intensified thereafter as well. He and his parents had it set up and running in minutes. And all 3 were having a ball playing with it. My grandson played by himself all afternoon, only stopping when it was time to leave. The whole family was anxious to get it home to connect it to their previous Hot Wheels track sets. All were amazed to find that ALL Hot Wheels cars, new and old, worked well staying on track....until the crashes of course! Money very well spent😁
reviews.review_header: I am SOOO glad I chose this track set

reviews.review_text: Requires 4 D sized batteries. My son seems to like it. Pros: You get a lot for your money. With hotwheels, it can feel like you paid for a couple of pieces of track and a car. Overpriced. My 5 year old really enjoys playing with it and it crashes well. Cons: Whilst on, the motor is incredible LOUD! This is not a toy that can be played with in a normal setting. It is a constant, and quite annoying loud sound. Louder than a remote control car, but quieter than an airplane. If you don't mind a LOT of noise, this toy is great.
reviews.review_header: Good for Kid, but not good for parents sanity: very loud moter

reviews.review_text: We have had this track for over a year now and my boys still love it. I am very surprised that the motor and traction pads that push the cars along have held up this well. The track still launches cars and my kids still lose their minds when the cars crash into each other.The track is well built and they attach to the base without flimsy fragile parts. This thing has been run over with a power wheels car and the track pieces simply break away without damage. Mattel really makes these tracks to last. This track runs on C batteries that will last for many hours of play. If the cars no longer make it around the track completely either you have cars with old wheels, cars that don't fit the rollers well, or the batteries are getting weak. Look for cars that have "Track" on their packaging....they seem to work best with this track. If your kid is sensitive to loud noises this track is loud.

name: Hot Wheels 20 Cars Gift Pack, Styles May Vary

reviews.review_text: What is there really to say about Hot Wheels? I grew up with them and I love that my kids (boys and girls!) are playing with them too! These things take a beating! You can find some great deals online which will save you a bunch of money rather than buying them individually at the store. True care aficionados might get annoyed at Hot Wheels because some of their cars are a bit fantastical, but hey, kids like funky colors and shapes and shiny things! We buy 20 packs of these things (usually costs less than lunch for two people) and we dole them out to the kids as incentives to clean their rooms, for potty training, whatever you can think of. They are the ultimate carrot for good behavior. Try putting them in a grab bag so your children are surprised every time they get one!! I try to make my reviews engaging and useful. Please click helpful if you thought this review was worthwhile. Thanks!
reviews.review_header: The ultimate carrot for good behavior!!

reviews.review_text: I bought this to make party favors for my son to pass out to his preschool class on his birthday. The set came with a great assortment of 20 Hot Wheels cars! There were even a couple pink/purple cars which some of the girls in his class loved! The price per car when buying this 20-car gift pack is much cheaper than buying a individual packs, 5-packs or 10-packs in the stores.
a great gift

So I got this item for my son for Christmas 2017. I received it earlier this month and I had opened it to make sure they were cars he’d like and that they were there. I counted, and there was only 19 cars. There was even an open spot for the missing one! Because I did like the rest of the cars for my son and did not want to deal with the hassle of a return and the possibility of different cars. I just went to Walmart and got a single car and added to the collection. But would have been nice if I did recieve all the cars.
reviews.review_header: Only got 19/20 cars, but looked cool

reviews.review_text: The adopted Grand son loved it. I saw some comments about the quality of the spring loaded wheels. I know what they were talking aout but didnt really notice any performance difference. And the younger generation wouldn't know anyway. We used these cars on a Hot Wheels track and they worked just fine.

I bought this pack as incentives to my toddler's potty training. He was very resistant to doing number 2 on the potty. After we received the pack, I made a big deal of it and promised that he can choose a hot wheel car every time he poops on the toilet. 5 cars later he's fully potty trained. We then used the cars as rewards for good behavior. They're very realistic looking, fun to play with, and, a great motivator.
reviews.review_header: We then used the cars as rewards for good behavior. They're very realistic looking

reviews.review_text: Bought 2 of these 20-car sets (and confirmed same cars in both sets if you were wondering) as "Treasure Box" prizes for my wife's pre-K classroom. The boys all love them of course and the cars being less than a buck apiece is the best deal I've seen on Hot Wheels or Matchbox brand cars.

name: Hot Wheels Stunt n' Go Track Set

reviews.review_text: Cheap plastic made. My son can't pull the hauler because it opens up. The launcher is weak, only the car came in the box makes the loop because it has a plastic chassis. All the other hotwheel or matchbox cars with metal chassis are to heavy. I will try it with another rubber band, might be better if the rubber is stronger. So far the cheapest made and worst hotwheels toy we have.

You have to adjust the car and the starting"gate" angle just right in order for the car to go around the whole loop. It is a separate piece and comes apart easily, unfortunately. May be difficult for smaller children to understand each time but once you know how to do it, it does work well. My 4yo grandson loves it.

You have to really mess around with the rubberband to get it to work appropriately. We had to scrounge around the house to find a good rubberband. The one provided just led to dissappointment. Good idea for a toy but it is annoying.
reviews.review_header: We had to scrounge around the house to find a good rubberband. The one provided just led to dissappointment

reviews.review_text: I agree with the other reviews. Worked with it for about an hour and could not get ANY hot wheel cars to make the loop. My grandson finally got frustrated with it. Am happy with other products but this one is a dud.

Grammas happy,my grandson loves it he is 6, way to little to pull back the rubber band which I didn't see .I probably threw it out because it clear.so I used one of my cheap hair ties.and I also didn't have it clicked in there right.but it's a great toy.gives the adult a reason to play with the child.I also have to hit it hard to make it zoom.
reviews.review_header: Make sure you click it together right

reviews.review_text: We have a few hundred Hot Wheels cars, many of them were the ones that say best for track two. Very few cars make it around the loop. Most go halfway up the loop and fall off. Even less will make it so they can jump off and land on the other part. I would rather get the track builder Loop with another launcher.
reviews.review_header: Most cars don't make it around the loop.

reviews.review_text: It's a rubber band powered jump so it's not that easy to do (for a dad). In due time I suppose. Good toy for travel though. No batteries needed.
reviews.review_header: ... a rubber band powered jump so it's not that easy to do (for a dad)

reviews.review_text: I wasted my money buying something that looked like so much fun for my son. I was forewarned with some of the reviews saying the car wouldn’t at all clear the loop, but I took a chance since there were also positive reviews. After a couple hours of extreme frustration trying to launch a single car around the loop, it’s now collecting dust in the corner of my living room.

name: Hot Wheels Track Builder Stunt Box

reviews.review_text: This is a great set and I love that it can also be used as storage. This is especially great if you are just starting out with hot wheels sets because it is entertaining enough on its own. My 5 year old loves the launcher and has used it with the other hot wheels track pieces he already had. I purchased it for $11, and that was a great value!

I bought this track for my son for his 2nd birthday. He loves it even though he can't pull the car launcher back himself. It was easy to put together, can be configured in a variety of patterns, and both my 2YO and 4YO enjoy playing with it. The lid and box the pieces come in are actually part of the track.
reviews.review_header: It was easy to put together

reviews.review_text: Absolutely love it! This is a track for my son's 5th birthday. I love that it is a connector set for all the hot wheels tracks. He has been having connecting this set up to his other launcher. I love the bucket for storage and cleaning. The hardest part was trying to remove the blue connectors. Pressing the middle down while trying to pull it between the thre lower track is tricky.
reviews.review_header: Absolutely love it! This is a track for my son's ...

reviews.review_text: Really great play set that is it’s own box, and at a really good price. The tracks are flexible and don’t break easily. One of the best parts is the launcher, which is really durable. It doesn’t use rubber bands to launch the car, it just uses one to pull the lever back into place after launch. This is much better than the bow-and-arrow type of launchers that Hot Wheels makes, because those break quickly due to all the stress and it’s hard to find replacements. It’s actually easy to change the track configuration. Hot wheels cars work well on it, but a lot of matchbox cars don’t (which is fine). I think every Hot Wheels car we have is compatible with the tracks themselves, and probably 30-40% of them are compatible enough to be launched and complete the 2 loops configuration. They have to have certain shapes/weights to work really well with the launcher, so you just have to try different cars to see which ones work. But that’s fun, too.

The box is handy for storing tracks and cars but the turn sections are oddly shaped so the cars usually go flying off rather than smoothly bank around the turn. If the turn sections worked well this would be a 5-star kit. As-is it's frustrating to build with my son.
My grandson loves this toy, very sturdy and well worth the money
On its own it's okay but you buy more track's etc that's when it shines. The launcher is mid teir
reviews.review_header: On its own it's okay but you buy more track's ...

reviews.review_text: Purchased for our 6 year old's birthday along with other sets. These are a little bit different than when I was a kid. The connecting pieces and tracks aren't compatible with the stuff from the 90's, but that's ok as you really can't even find that stuff used anymore. While they are a bit pricey, these sets are awesome. The ones that come in the buckets/boxes are great as there is plenty of extra space to put in cars and pieces from other sets. From my experience these are perfect for any kid aged 5-6 all the way up to grandparents. anyone can have fun playing with hot wheels cars and tracks. If you liked this review and it was helpful to you, please consider marking it as helpful and checking out some of my other reviews. If you have any questions at all please ask.

name: Hot Wheels 24-Car Random Assortment Party Pack 2014 and Newer

reviews.review_text: Bought these as gifts for my daughters 7th birthday party. Am very impressed by the variety and no duplicates. Some are roadsters, hot rods, classics, street cars. Soemalso say they are best for tracks. 8 of 24 say new for 2017. I’m very pleased. Will update once the little boys get them to see what they thought.
reviews.review_header: Great value at $1 per car. Great for bday treat bags

reviews.review_text: I had been looking for a set of a lot of cars in them. We are using them as rewards for my son as we go through potty training. This set came with a good variety of different cars and my son loves opening up a new one each day!
reviews.review_header: This set came with a good variety of different cars and my son loves opening ...

reviews.review_text: I have ordered these 3 times and think I only have one duplicate car! Extremely random selection. Perfect for my little guy going through potty training. These make the best incentives

I was disappointed that there were so many duplicates. I ordered them for our new foster son thinking that it would be a great start to his collection and was bummed that there were three of several models and two of many.
Great selection for a first time buyer! My 2 year old boys are obsessed with these so I’m sure I’ll be buying more. Will buy from this seller when I do.
Very happy with the assortment of different cars. They range from realistic to cartoon type vehicles. No two were the same. All perfect for my grandson!

All the cars were there and in good shape! If you don’t care about the packaging then this is a great deal. My only issue was the packaging looked old. I was donating to charity so I took the cars out of the packs and it was fine.
reviews.review_header: All the cars were there and in good shape! If you don’t care about the packaging ...

name: Hot Wheels Super Ultimate Garage Playset

reviews.review_text: We have the ultimate car garage and purchased the super ultimate for the motorized elevator and tall exit ramp. Like other Hot Wheels toys with a motor, the elevator motor is very loud. We expected this, but didn't expect that even when the parking level latches are completely closed, the cars would get stuck every few seconds. The motor makes fast clicking sounds until the car can continue up the elevator to the level of choice. A minor problem is one parking space each on levels 1,2, and 3 don't have a raised bumper so the cars can stay in the parking space. If you have a child who is very particular about having a uniform look to his parking garage, this might be an issue. Cars race smoothly down the spiral ramp which is @ 29 inches tall. The tall spiral ramp is the best feature of this parking garage. The yellow wheel on level 4 requires some effort as it doesn't turn smoothly. The parking garage levels on 1, 2, and 3 near the spiral ramp slope down because the supports are @ 3 inches from the end of each level. If the motorized elevator worked well, the $199 price would be justified, even with the minor flaws. If the elevator was a manual one, I'd still pay $199 for the garage. But as is, I wouldn't pay more than $125 for this toy because of the elevator issue. We have had the garage for two days and my son refuses to play with the motorized elevator. If you're making a purchase decision between the super ultimate and the ultimate parking garages, choose the ultimate. The value is great and it doesn't have the design issues the super one has. If you already have the ultimate and are thinking of purchasing the super ultimate, you might want to wait until the price decreases. Ours is going back.
reviews.review_header: The super ultimate garage that isn't super

reviews.review_text: My two little boys love toy cars - Hot Wheels, Matchbox, or whatever generic brand - and my household has a small fleet of the miniature toys, track sets, and everything in between. So we obviously jumped at the chance to try out Hot Wheels Super Ultimate Garage and the results are... a bit mixed. My kids obviously love this toy but as I parent there are some big drawbacks to this toy that should definitely be considered prior to purchasing. ------------------- ► Assembly: ------------------- This toy is HUGE! So it should be no surprise that it features a lot of plastics. For the most part, I think the quality of the plastics is pretty good; nothing feels like it's going to snap or break easily. The orange Hot Wheels track is pliable and easily takes the punishment from two active boys. Assembly instructions feature a full-color instruction booklet that covers every step of the process in good detail. The only tool required is a small Philips screwdriver used to open the battery compartment and install four (4) 'D' batteries (not included). The batteries operate the mechanical vehicle lift and gorilla. The rest of the components just snap together or, in the case of the track, feature plastic fasteners that slide on. There's also a small sticker booklet that contains stickers for certain parts of the garage (floor labels). My kids helped me out and we had this Super Ultimate Garage together in about 30-minutes. ------------------- ► Playtime Thoughts: ------------------- As I mentioned my kids love this garage and my sons actually have enough parking to fit nearly all of their cars in one spot! Make sure you have a spot picked out to fit this toy prior to purchasing. This garage is massive at over 3' tall by about 4' long! Since we own a lot of other Hot Wheels track and sets we also love that you can incorporate more track to this garage, truly making it part of the Hot Wheels ecosystem! The toy can be configured to drop cars off at various floors thanks to gates operated on the rear of the corkscrew elevator. Cars exiting at the top floor can be configured to ramp through the jet at the top of the toy and down the orange track for another trip up the elevator. Pretty cool! ------------------- ► What Could be Better: ------------------- There are some things I don't particularly care for with this toy that any potential buyer should be aware of: → The motorized vehicle lift (corkscrew) is really loud, even more so when the gorilla reaches the top of the toy and slides all the way down. → The lift does not work well at all. Large cars are just incompatible and will fail to move onto the lift. Other cars get frequently jammed causing even more noise as the corkscrew struggles to rotate. It seems that the cars that work best are the smaller, simpler Hot Wheels but that won't stop kids from sending any car onto the lift. ------------------- ► Closing: ------------------- I'm not quite convinced this toy is worth the rather whopping asking price. My kids definitely love it but there are some major drawbacks, particularly if you're not a fan of loud toys. The vehicle elevator needs to be improved as it's incompatible with probably 50% of the Hot Wheels cars we own.
reviews.review_header: Huge Hot Wheels Garage but Loud and Some Features Aren't Great

reviews.review_text: This toy garage is BIG. So before you purchase, think about where you will put it. I had to remove my coffee table to make space for it. Assembly is fairly simple and took about 20-30 minutes. My boys (ages 19 months, 4 and 5 years) were excited to race on the loop and the jet plane on top. My boys liked the motorized elevator a lot but the problem we experienced with the gorilla made their excitement turn to constant frustration. Perhaps ours is defective because I haven’t read about others experiencing this, but in our case the gorilla’s foot keeps jamming and stalling the elevator. This garage is twice the price of the original Hot Wheels garage (which my kids still play with), so we expected this new one to be out of this world! Sadly, it isn’t. We have also purchased the Super Auto Tomica Building and other Tomica play sets which are wonderful! They are worth the money. The Hot Wheels Super Ultimate Car Garage is over priced, with a slow motorized elevator, malfunctioning gorilla and lacks the bells and whistles. The parking spots aren’t even numbered. That would have added some educational value to this game. My advice: Save you money and look into Tomica’s play sets. You won’t be disappointed.
reviews.review_header: Overpriced. Malfunctioning. Bigger doesn’t make it better!

name: Hot Wheels Roto Revolution Track Set

reviews.review_text: My poor son got this on his 5th birthday and its garbage. We put it together and the cars keep coming off the tracks!! My brother in law is an engineer and he even said it was designed poorly. What a waste.

It does not work. The racecar barely gets 1/4 up the loop and then falls. It falls all the time! We have tried several different cars of all sizes/ weights, and some of them barely made one loop a couple of times before falling, but that was rare and then the car still falls! It is a complete waste of money! It literally does not work and it uses a ton of batteries.

This is a lot like the Hot Wheels Criss Cross Crash set, which uses roughly the same base/wheels loops out/over. This one changes it up a bit, it only has 3 loops and they go upside down instead of more out, and every time they come back through the car flips a lever so it goes into the other track section. The other major change is that when you turn it on, the item itself rotates as well. This means you can line up cars to shoot into the tracks, and have to get the timing just right, otherwise it won't make it in. (You can also fire the car at the switch to stop it all). Getting a couple of cars going makes a nice crash, which of course is the best part. It is fairly large, but packs up a bit easier than other sets. Playability is about the same as the criss cross set, ultimately not a ton of stuff to do with it, but my 5 and 7 year olds still like it. It is loud when on and a car running on it (and of course it takes 4 D batteries, under two screw attached lids).

reviews.review_text: I'm disappointed with this toy. It's hard to explain if you haven't seen it up close, but there are levers that are supposed to swing back and forth allowing the cars to go on one side or the other. On ours, they don't swing very well, so the cars just hit it and stop and fall off. So they never go even once around the loops. What am I missing?
reviews.review_header: Not working well. Cars crash into levers, don't loop.

reviews.review_text: Let me start off buy saying that this is a fun track to play with when you can get it working right. The key there is when you get it working right. You have to launch the cars into the revolution track by hitting a door which is part of one of the loops. If you miss the door, then you have to wait until the track spins around to find the other door. Some cars work better than others, this is the case with all hot wheels tracks, but the most I have had the cars go around is 5 or so times. Then they crash, which is part of the fun, but there is a lot of effort for the enjoyment. It is disappointing when you get cars which have the wrong shape or are too tall and they go around the loop once before falling down. The other thing to watch is to make sure you put good batteries in this toy. Some batteries will lose power quicker which makes the launching wheels move somewhat slower. This matters if you have a heavier car or oddly shaped one as they will be more likely to fall while making the loop.
reviews.review_header: Frustrating to get the timing right

reviews.review_text: Totally lame. We sent it back. The cars don't even make one loop before they fall off the track. We've tried everything but it's just poorly made.

My son however LOVES the competition of seeing who's car will crash first, he LOVES seeing them crash and fall off. Sometimes they go for quite a while which is very exciting to him.

This was a bit touchy at first to make sure the tracks were completely flat, and one car took a while to work correctly; however, when the kinks got worked out it was amazing!!! All of my kids loved it and they have asked to play almost every day since. If you're looking for flawless, this isn't it, but if you're looking for casual and very fast-paced competitive play: you've found it!
