name: Hot Wheels Car & Mega Track Pack

reviews.review_text: Two sides to this....on one side it's a fair amount of track for the price, plus you get a car. One positive to this track set is that smaller pieces do allow you to do some things that the larger track won't let you unless you cut it into smaller pieces. On the other side, I don't think this package is worth buying for three reasons. The first is that you can buy 2 ft. track pieces at Toys 'R Us and you can get about the same amount of track in large piece form for about the same amount of money (minus the car which wasn't that good anyway). The second reason is that these smaller pieces make the track fit together with more track connectors, thus making it more flimsy. The third reason is that the track walls on the track in this set are much shorter than the track walls on the 2 ft. long track pieces that are sold at Toys 'R Us. Overall, I wouldn't say not to buy this, but if you are just looking for lots of track length, save your money and go to Toys 'R Us.

I wanted to buy some race tracks for my grandson, who was 2 years old, to go with some Hot Wheels that he liked. We didn't use this as add on to a main race track. My husband said it was ok to get the 2 year old some basic track. It's been a great purchase. My grandson (who is now almost 3) uses it every time he visits. We move the track on top of pillows or chairs or books to give it some lift which makes it really versatile. Great product.

For the price I think this is a great track set! 40 feet goes a long way! Our hope was to be able to combine this with a high speed curve to run all the way down our stairs (see video and pics) and we have way more than enough for that! My only complaints are that I wish the tracks were made to connect to each other without an extra piece (the blue thing). It's just a hassle to store all of the loose pieces when you take them apart. Also, why don't they make and include curves at all? That would really open up the possibilities a lot. Beyond that, I have no other complaints and my son really enjoys building really long tracks down stairs and off the table and couch etc. It comes with a car and works with non-hot wheels brand cars as well. I even think the price is pretty fair for what you get! I can definitely recommend for kids who like to think BIG when it comes to track layouts, but if you're going to get the most out of it, I definitely recommend buying a high speed curve to supplement. Hope this helps!
reviews.review_header: Perfect set for the stairs! Just needs a curve to go with it.

reviews.review_text: Such a cheap and awesome gift for kids. My 2 year old loves it. I bought a cheap clamp at a hardware store to clamp the top of the track to a counter or table. My little boy loves putting the cars on the track and watching it go down. I also bought a hot wheels loop to make it more interesting. Still with this 15ft of track by itself it allows plenty of length to create your own track designs or ramps. I wish I had this when I was a kid. The loop was like $20 and other hot wheels track accessories get pretty expensive considering what they do. This is easily the best value hot wheels track.

Bought this for my grand nephew the other day. 4yo. Man, to watch a kid's eyes light up after the first car is launched squarely into his aunt's neck. That's one for the ages, huh? Consequently, it bought back the memory of the "second" use of that track that we need not talk about from this point on.

I bought these for the 3rd grade classroom I work in. I'm a teacher's aid and the tracks in the classroom were wearing out. The teacher liked these so much he asked me to order another set for him. The way they snap together and stay together is wonderful. 3rd grade kids are rough on toys these still look brand new.
reviews.review_header: Tough enough to survive a classroom

reviews.review_text: Bought these hot wheel tracks (who knew there were tracks?) for my granddaughter who is three and enjoys playing with her Dad’s old hot wheel cars 🚘. They connect easily and do not fall apart easily. Prop the tracks on pillows or books to make hills and watch the cars zoom! She loves them! I bought the “Curve Accessory” and some pink girlie cars to go with the track. This track does come with one 🚙. Good interactive play!

My 5 year old son wanted me to post that it should get 5 stars so here they are. I bought this to attach to another hotwheel set that didn't come in yet but my son is having a lot of fun with it. He drapes it over couches and chairs and has it winding all over the place because even though the tracks are straight they are flexible. He then lets his car go and it whizzes across his creation. He enjoys it a lot and that is a big surprise for something I thought was just some extra tracks. It's a little difficult to take apart and I worry that it may break but so far it hasn't.

reviews.review_text: I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT. I found myself putting this toy together on Christmas Eve night, intending for it to be a Santa gift Christmas morning. We were excited to give this to our three-year-old, but unfortunately it turned out to be a horrible toy. There were no instructions for assembly or sticker placement, and on top of that there were no pre-drilled holes for the screws. I finally muscled it together, but Christmas morning my son discovered cars would get stuck at each corner of the track. The Ultimate Garage I got for my ten-year-old was MUCH EASIER to assemble than this, took less time and worked better. We ended up buying our other son a V-tech track to replace this one.

We purchased this for our 2 yr old grandson and he has played with it more than any other toy he has by far. We bought a second one to have at his house. Wi did buy an extra track pack or two (less than $3 each) to extend the track a bit and add one to the other side if the toy.

Like most of the reviews claimed, assembly was difficult due to no holes. I don’t understand why they can provide holes, I received a blister trying to screw the parts on. This table is kind of flimsy and not all the cars slide through the track easy. I wouldn’t recommend this toy. Purchase a better quality and sturdy activity table instead.

My 4 year old loves this so much. He hasn't stopped playing with it. You will need an electric screwdriver though because there are no screw holes at all. Other than that, it was extremely easy to put together. If the cars don't go around the track on their own, unscrew the screws a little and adjust the tracks. I had to mess with it a couple of times to get them to roll right. I also bought a couple of track packs to extend it a bit.
reviews.review_header: it was extremely easy to put together

reviews.review_text: Great toy but a pain to put together. It says all you need is a screw driver. Not True you need a drill. You have to drill your own holes for the screws. But finished product is sturdy and my twin boys age 7 love it. Bought this because they both have autism and this is there speed toy wise. I need to purchos more tracks.

Looks fun. It's a pain to put together without a drill. The connecting tracks seem too long and bow, hump, or twist. Most cars make it down the ramps, but some weirdly do not. I think the ramps could have been better than they are.
reviews.review_header: Tough to put together, parts seem like they don't fit.

reviews.review_text: Highly disappointed! Cars do not zoom down track! They go 8 inches then stop! Nothing cool about this toy! My kids expected the cars to zoom around and build up speed! I’m only keeping it because it took my husband so long to put it together!

For the price I expected for the cars to at least go down the ramp smoothly. No amount of tweaking made it a smooth cruise down. As someone who knows better I’m disappointed but my 2 1/2 year doesn’t mind pushing the cars when they get stuck half of the way down.

reviews.review_text: The Hot Wheels Super Spin Tire Shop Vehicle Playset has been a huge hit in our house. Yes, the other reviews are correct. The car that comes with the playset gets stuck and other cars also get stuck as well, but my 5 year-old honestly does not care. The playset comes assembled with one Hot Wheels car included. There is an arm that pushes the car up the ramp. The arm moves by turning the rim on the top of the playset. The car then goes into the chute and you pull the lever on the big wheel, which shoots the car out a chute on the bottom. The Hot Wheel Super Spin Tire Vehicle Playset can connect to other Hot Wheel City Playsets. Of course, they are sold separately and you will need to purchase tracks to to connect them. No batteries required. It's relatively quiet and keeps my son occupied for hours with his other sets.

reviews.review_header: It's all plastic and over priced for what you get.

reviews.review_text: Best Case available anywhere at any price $49 a great price I bought 3 ,got them today there the best . love the truck with real rubber tires buy them while you can best buy ever .
reviews.review_header: Best Case available anywhere at any price $49 a great price

reviews.review_text: Was able to find it at $49 even though I’m not a prime member. Very happy with it

Love this display! Good build quality, comes with stands for tabletop placement or can be mounted on the wall. The doors stay closed well but are also easy to open without disturbing the cars on display. Also, well packaged for shipping, box within a box style. Love the logos as well. A very good value, high quality thicker plastic then other value display units
reviews.review_header: Sturdy, well constructed, worth the price!

reviews.review_text: This case can be sit on a table top or mounted on a wall. It looks great and displays cars well. It is just made of complete plastic but still looks great. The exclusive 83 Chevy Silverado looks very cool and very detailed. Great buy for anyone into hot wheels collecting.
reviews.review_header: Just an awesome simple display case.

reviews.review_text: Very well constructed case. Sturdy but lightweight. Good materials. Functional and cool looking. Can be hung or installed standing with included support legs. A BONUS is the Silverado squarebody. NICE!!!!
reviews.review_header: Worth the $50 easily... even without the Silverado.

reviews.review_text: Saw these on Amazon , bought 3 of them after becoming prime member. Only way to get them for 49.00 apiece, but it was worth it. They say it holds up to 50 cars, but has 48 slots, can be hung on the wall or stand up on flat surface. I would buy 3 more for this price, good luck finding it though. Overall- love it

name: Hot Wheels 4-Lane Elimination Race Track Set (Amazon Exclusive)

reviews.review_text: We were looking for a "race car track" for our "gonna be 3" grandson, and looking for something that would be an easy set-up for everyone. We looked at a few electric tracks, but we figured, well, if he wants to use it someone will have to watch him the whole time, set it up for him, take it down,... just a lot of prep time that we figured would just not get done sometimes. As we were searching, a Hot Wheels track popped up. Man, I had one of those back in the `60`s. I started looking around on Amazon, and found this 4 lane race track. What a cool track! It has 4 lanes, a single start lever,(all lanes start at the same time), and the coolest trick, (besides being able to fold up and carry it like a briefcase), the winner notification. We ordered it right away. Well, when he opened this track up, was he excited! We set it up in about 2 minutes, he was racing about 30 seconds after that. I have to say, this was a very nice purchase. Our daughter called the other day, as we talking we asked where Jak, (not a misspell), was, she said she set his track up for him and he was racing. I`ll agree, this is not the most sturdy track made, but, for a first multi-lane, learning about winning and losing toy, this is an excellent buy. If this is around when our other daughter has a son, well then he just might get one of these tracks for his third birthday.

If you need to wear some kids out this is super. Children love this. They race cars for hours. This is very durable. It lasted a few years in a kindergarten class environment. So you can't ask for much more. Eventually the connectors that hold the track together broke. But lots of children got much more than their money's worth out of this. It's great that children still love Hot Wheels.

I bought this 8 years ago, and yes I am just now leaving a review. It has become a Christmas Tradition with my Husband and sons buy a new Hot Wheel every year and race them. My son who was once 3 when this started looks forward to it every year. It has withstood the test of time of being played with by misc children, and the 3 year old that it was intentionally bought for for several years. Great investment!

My 2 boys (3rd and 5th graders) loved this track. Right out of the package it was a big hit! They loved racing their huge hotwheel collection. Then one of the latches on the track wore down and half of the track was no longer usable. As one car crosses the gate, both gates pop up (not just one of the gates as intended to indicate a winner and a loser). Would love to return this track because the defective latch is obviously shaped differently from the other 3 latches. However, it appears this is not an option since it was purchased 40 days ago.

Awesome..!!!~ If you can get this for your kids (boy or girl) you will be happy! At our house, each family member picks the hot-wheel car we think is a winner, then have a race to see who finishes first. There is a starting gate lever that makes the take-off fair and a flag a the finish line to help determine the winner. If you only have a few hot wheel cars....or a family like us with a tub full, this is the best add-on to make the cars more interesting to the whole family.

This was bought as a side present for my son (5 years old) cause he loves hot wheels...I loved that it folded up and not a lot of parts so even he can put it together unlike all the other more complicated hot wheels track...this ended up being a great little toy and highly recommended...snaps back together easily...able to with stand a lot of wear and tear...and even my older kids love it! And since there are 4 tracks it makes it fun for the whole family to play together and race one another!! Very fun toy...a year later it still is a common toy that gets pulled out and played with! Even my 1 year old enjoys racing the cars and running after them and doing it over and over again!! LOVE THIS TOY!!!

I purchased this item from Amazon last xmas for around $20 for my 4 year old son. I must say, he absolutely loves this toy. He is rough, so it kept collapsing at first.... but as time went on, he learned how to use it without making the track fall over. Now, I also have an 11 year old son... you would think I purchased this thing for him. He abandoned his xbox 360 for this $20 toy!! laugh! Here it is 1 year later and guess what... (age 5 and 11) They both are still playing with it. Its not flimsy, it is well made, but its not for a 3 year old. (although they can use it, they may keep knocking it over). I would purchase it again if I had to, but not for $80!!! ARE THEY CRAZY!! ITs not worth that, but I love it way more than any hot wheels track set that i've ever purchased for either of my sons! If money is not an option for you, then get it.. i'm sure your child will have endless enjoyment with this toy. They can play quietly (of course unless one of the kids is a sore loser!! then you'll have to deal with the tears) and they will have lots of fun! GREAT PURCHASE!!
reviews.review_header: Purchased 1 year ago and He still LOVES it!

reviews.review_text: Any toy my kids will play with for more than 20 minutes is worth writing a positive review. They'll play with it for even longer, and it doesn't take batteries?! Fabulous! My son got this when he was 3, and is now nearly 5 and still plays with it quite often. The only minor annoyance is that he still can't figure out how to fold it up to put away, and since we like to teach self-sufficiency around here that's a small drawback. Son's older sister likes to play along with him, too. It's fun to find things they can play together with.

The invoices are extremely confusing and when we go to pay it is for items we purchased a few months prior which normally isn't bad, but can be when we get to the end of the fiscal year. Also the first page tends to list more items then what the total payment due box says which is confusing. Only list on that page what has to be paid for. Lastly, for our account purposes we need the itemized invoice for what is being paid for in the current invoice. Currently I have to find the previous months invoice to get the itemized list so I can pay the current month's invoice. So in other words, the amount that is due should also have the itemized invoice in the following pages in addition to the other active charges. I can't pay for an item if I can't code it in our budget and I shouldn't have to flip between different invoices from different months to figure it out. Keep it simple. These are the only invoices I have ever seen created in such a convoluted way. Every other invoice I handle is clear about what is being paid for accept this one.
reviews.review_header: ... we purchased a few months prior which normally isn't bad, but can be when we get to the ...

reviews.review_text: While the credit line is a convenience, the invoicing as it is handled by the third-party servicing provider is cumbersome to use. Product descriptions are truncated on the purchase detail provided. This makes it necessary for me to frequently take the extra step to research our purchases on our account in order to be able to code them. There is no total provided on the statement, again adding an extra step so I can be sure I am paying the correct amount. Since I opened the revolving credit line knowing it needed to be paid in full each month, I don't understand the point of checking off the boxes next to each purchase in order to be sure they are credited to the account. I feel with the sophisticated and impressive technology typically employed by Amazon, this style of invoicing is....inconsistent.
reviews.review_header: While the credit line is a convenience, the invoicing ...

reviews.review_text: Even though both my SS and DOB are correctly entered I kept getting the same below as encountered by other reviewers. Error message: "Your response to following fields is invalid Date of Birth can not be less than 8 characters. Social Security Number can not be less than 9 characters."
reviews.review_header: Don't waste your time filling out the form!

reviews.review_text: An absolute must for businesses, churches, etc. I pastor a small church which has a relatively low maximum on our business credit card. Amazon's corporate credit line gave me a very generous maximum credit line, allowed us to be sales tax exempt because we are a non-profit, and it is so simple to make a purchase. We can either use a P.O. Number or just our line of credit. A nicely detailed statement comes in the mail and I verify and approve it and turn it over to our treasurer/accountant for payment. I love it! Easiest way to purchase what we need, receive it with Amazon's always speedy shipment, and settle up when the statement comes in. If you have a church or business and don't have this you are missing out.
reviews.review_header: A nicely detailed statement comes in the mail and I verify ...

reviews.review_text: It's the easiest way to to have a business account associated with your personal account. This way you can pick and choose which account you want your purchase charged to. Only annoying thing is that the "Corporate" option will not show up as a payment option unless you choose the business address for delivery. I understand that's a security feature to protect against fraud but in our situation it's unnecessary and an annoyance. Other than that, no complaints.

The site does not work I too am having problems all fields are correct. It comes back and says that SS need to be 9 numbers. Then it says that the Birthdate has to be at least 8 numbers. It does not show any errors but never able to complete the application online.

I like the convenience of ordering things and paying in full. I do not like the way it is set up however. There is an order number when you order but on the credit card statement there is an invoice number and nothing to tie the two together except the amount and listed items. This makes it hard to reconcile the orders with the bill. It takes too much time to figure out. The billing seems to be lag behind quite a bit. We only pay bills once a month so it makes it difficult to make sure all invoices are paid. The statement doesn't reach us until after the deadline for our monthly bills.
reviews.review_header: love the convenience, BUT not the billing cycle

reviews.review_text: Wish there was a mechanism to have items categorized, such as book, video, video game, office supply, etc. Even if I could input that information when I ordered, it would help with my budget. As it is, I need to go through every invoice (lots) and try to determine which it is and then, if I can't remember, I need to look it up. It is essential to have this broken down for line items within our budget.

name: Batman: Metal Die-Cast Bat-Signal

reviews.review_text: My original review is below, but I've since heard from the manufacturer and they have resolved the issue with the battery cover screws. Apparently, the problem was discovered and corrected prior to the lamps shipping, but my unit didn't receive the fix for some reason. I'm happy to take them at their word and upgrade my 2 star rating as this really is a great little collectible. This is really a great looking little lamp and very well made too... with one big exception. The battery cover is accessed by removing 4 little jeweler's screws on the diecast rear of the light and those screws thread through 4 little nuts on the back of the plastic battery compartment beneath. The problem is 2 out of 4 of the screws on mine spun freely because the nuts had rounded out their plastic fittings before I even attempted to loosen them. I'm guessing the factory assembly torqued the screws far too hard... which meant I couldn't get the battery cover off. After 30 minutes of prying, pulling, and patience I finally got it loose... spinning one of the nuts all the way through the plastic in the process. It still works, albeit short of two fastening screws, but what an incredibly frustrating experience. I love everything else about it... it's a fantastic little collectible and the accompanying book is very well done as well. I would have called this a bargain at under $20, but it's really too bad their manufacturing quality control isn't on par with all the design work that went into this.

I preordered this piece as soon as I read the item description. It is an amazing replica of the Bat-signal!!! Highly detailed, it easily moves up and down, swivels left and right, and is masterfully crafted of metal, so it has a good amount of weight. The best part is that the signal actually functions!! Housed within it's metallic shell is an actual LED bulb which once activated, casts a genuine, vivid call for the Dark Knight in any direction you point the Bat-Signal!! The accompanying hard cover comic is full of great art and descriptions from throughout the long history of the Caped Crusading Detective. This is truly a must have for any true Bat-Fan!!!
reviews.review_header: A Real Call In The Knight!!

reviews.review_text: Wow this thing is amazing I was not expecting this kinda construction the size and the packaging even the book are all outstanding I've added 2 more to my basket I was expecting this to be kinda garbage for what I paid I could of not been more wrong honestly this is worth triple the price I am a huge collector I have been doing it for man 30 years it's hard to impress me this much I honestly hope these are still here and the same price next month when I get paid I will stock up on these there that good and if you have the large batmobile and batwing from the animated series this fits perfect with that collection I'm in shock right now
reviews.review_header: Unbelievable how much I paid first time ever I've felt like I'm ripping off a company

reviews.review_text: This is a good quality die cast replica of the Bat Signal that also comes with a mini book detailing the history of the bat signal in the comics. The bat signal is 5 inches tall and in addition to looking good, really projects an image of the bat signal on walls or other surfaces. See my video for a fuller review of all features, a 360 look and a quick discussion of the companion book.
reviews.review_header: This Bat Signal Packs a Punch!

reviews.review_text: I would have paid full price for it! The light is very bright and casts a clear signal. The screws are a little tough to get out for battery placement. Use a screwdriver from an eyeglass repair kit to avoid stripping the screws.
reviews.review_header: I would have paid full price for it! The ...

reviews.review_text: We bought this as a Xmas gift. It's very cool for a boy! We had to ask a replacement for the first item they sent us, because the screws tend to be very hard to come out, and one of them we weren't able to unscrew. Second item they sent as a replacement was better! Hopefully the battery will last a while so that they won't need to unscrew the back often.
reviews.review_header: Cool gift, screws in the back a little defective.

reviews.review_text: Arrived on time and in great condition. It is built very well and a very sturdy piece of DC decor for sure ! Very much enjoyed adding it to the collection. Be sure to have a tiny screw driver ready to remove the metal battery plate ....
reviews.review_header: Arrived on time and in great condition. It is built very well and a ...

reviews.review_text: Got this for my nerdy BIL, he giggled like a girl when he saw it! Perfect gift for the nerdy ones in your life and deserve something cool! He popped batteries in and it was good to go. Color and brightness of the Bat signal was impressive.

This is one of my favorite Batman movies. Not because of Michael Keaton's portrayal as Batman which was a little understated, but because of Jack Nicholson's over the top portrayal of The Joker. He just stole the show. Gotham City was in turmoil until Batman comes on the scene. He cleans up the corruption and crime in his own inimitable way. Michael Keaton's Bruce Wayne characterization was spot on. He was suave and debonair and he and Kim Basinger made a great pair - very classy. The opening scene where Batman confronts two thugs who just robbed a family of their money and jewels is classic. If you want to spend two hours and six minutes with a good action movie, then this is it.

If you want the complete Batman score and soundtrack to the classic 1989 movie, then buy this CD (Batman Motion Picture Soundtrack by Prince) and also the Batman Original Motion Picture Score composed by Danny Elfman. This soundtrack by Prince is good, but not worthy of 5 stars. It's 4 stars at best. I used to have this album on vinyl back in 1989. I bought the CD back in 2007. Here are the songs: 1. The Future 2. Electric Chair 3. The Arms Of Orion 4. Partyman 5. Vicki Waiting 6. Trust 7. Lemon Crush 8. Scandalous 9. Batdance My favorite songs are "Partyman", "Trust", "Scandalous", and "Batdance". Jack Nicholson's laugh at the beginning of "Batdance" at the 0:07 second mark sounds exactly like one of Cesar Romero's laughs from the 1960s TV series, but I don't recall that particular Nicholson laugh being used in any scene in the movie. Romero was a trailblazing and highly influential Joker, so it's possible Nicholson was experimenting with Romero's laugh. The song "Scandalous" is played during the closing credits in the movie. I don't know, some of these Prince songs didn't quite fit the movie, yet the stuff is easy to listen to and accept. Just for the record, I like the 1989 Batman movie WAY better than The Dark Knight (2008). The Joker in The Dark Knight, played by Heath Ledger, just wasn't The Joker at all. Instead, it was just some psychopath who was wearing clown makeup. He wasn't funny, he was way too serious (hey, Heath - why so serious?), and above all, Christopher Nolan's Batman trilogy in general was just waaaaaaay too serious, thus not permitting The Joker to use the classic Joker gadgets like a hand buzzer and squirting lapel flower. Nolan sucked all the fun out of Batman with his Law & Order/NYPD Blue/CSI feel to the movies. He created such real world settings, yet we have Batman and Rachel Dawes falling 25 stories from a building and not getting killed (in fact, not even injured), we have Harvey Dent walking around with half a face, we have Harvey Dent flipping over a car and not getting injured or killed, we have a horse that breathes fire, we have a mask that has bats flying out of it, I can go on and on and on. The plot holes in all three movies are numerous. Another thing - all I see in these movies are tons of cops, tons of cop cars, cops in riot gear, and SWAT teams galore. If I want to see this kind of stuff, all I have to do is turn on the news, like CNN for example, or watch the above mentioned shows. Basically these movies are crime dramas that happen to include a guy called Batman, which makes a guy who dresses up as a bat look ridiculous and totally out of place. Tim Burton, the director of Batman (1989) and Batman Returns (1992) got it right. His movies were true comic book movies with a comic book feel to them, thus requiring the audience to suspend disbelief. If I see a guy on the screen who dresses up as a bat, I know it's not something in real life, it's something from a comic book movie. If I see somebody in everyday reality dressed as Batman, I can assure you it's only in late October or on the day of a comic book convention. Every time I watch the 2008 movie and then immediately watch the 1989 right after, I always say to myself while I'm watching the 1989 movie, "Now THIS is a Batman movie. Now THIS is The Joker. Now THIS is Gotham City." If I'm going to watch a Batman movie, the movie should allow me to escape reality and entertain me for a couple of hours, not remind me of reality and above all, totally mirror everyday society and take itself so seriously. These are just some of the reasons why Burton's movies are better than Nolan's movies.
reviews.review_header: Get Danny Elfman's score and this CD and you're all set

reviews.review_text: I am old enough to have seen this as an original release in the theaters. I was wondering how well it would stand the test of time especially against the Christopher Nolan franchise, though the only movie I have seen at this point is "Batman Begins." What I like about Burton's version over Nolan's is that Burton kept a little bit of camp from the TV series (yes I also watched this when it was on television), which gave some relief from the darkness of the film. Most of the camp comes from The Joker's side as Jack Nicholson plays His Joker as a psycho with a huge sense of humor. Michael Keaton play Bruce Wayne/Batman as understated and brooding, with little hints of psycho added to it. Together, they make a much, much darker version of Abbott and Costello. I also loved the look and feel of the 1940's that Tom Burton gave to the film, from the style of clothes that the main character's wore, to the architecture and even phones. It felt as if time had stopped from the moment that Bruce Wayne's parents died. Vicky Vale is the weakest link in this movie. My daughter asked me the next day what Vicky Vale contributed to the film and my reply was "She could scream musically and she was the set up for the battles between Batman and The Joker." This is not to denigrate Kim Basinger's performance, because it was definitely much stronger than Katie Holmes' screen presence in "Batman Begins." However in the big picture, how disappointing that their battles seem to be over a woman (to borrow from Joker's line). She also gave my pre-dating teenaged girls a really good lesson on why sleeping with a man on the first date is a REALLY bad idea. The only character played better on the "Batman Begins" was Alfred. That Michael Caine created a better Alfred was an unanimous decision with those of us who had seen both franchises. On the whole, this version has stood up against the test of time pretty well. The one daughter who has seen the Nolan series enjoyed this movie also and appreciated the bit of camp that was thrown into this version. Now I need to finally make time to watch "The Dark Knight".
reviews.review_header: Still really good after all of these years

reviews.review_text: I watched the Animated Series when they first aired some 25 years ago. Watching them again some 25 years later brings back a wave of nostalgia, from getting off school to watching Batman on an old 20" CRT TV at my grandparents' place, back when all there was to worry about was homework. In those formative years, I didn't appreciate the series the same way I do now. When I played them again on Amazon, I could hardly believe my ears: The title credits started with a bang: Full orchestration! As I dove deeper into each episode, letting the sounds of the orchestra and the voices from my childhood fill the living room, my love and appreciation for the series grows. The voice-acting is just terrific, from the way Batman conveys his moods and feelings to the seductive and voluptuous voices of Catwoman, Harley Quinn, and Poison Ivy, all without detracting from the fact that this was a series made for kids. Adults will still enjoy it. As for me, I will always think of the voice of Batman and the Joker as Kevin Conway and Mark Hamill. To this day, the way the Joker is animated and the way Hamill plays him still sends chills down my spine.

This series is CLASSIC! Don't underestimate it just because it is in a cartoon format. For newbies to Batman or DC universe, this is the standard that all Batman portrayals should be held to. Sure the plot isn't complicated; you know Batman is going to save the day and catch the bad guy, but that's not what's excellent about the series. It's how true to character the series is. Batman isn't just millionaire playboy who does vigilante work at night. He's a detective. Yes the detective in Detective Comics. Movies don't portray that part of him, but it's what makes him so different from the other superheroes in the DC universe, is his intelligence and sharp instincts. The villains are iconic and Mark Hamil as Joker is such a treat. Goes to show that even if for kids, cartoons don't have to always be cute and bubblegum (like most of CN's shows now). It's dark appeal, mysterious allure, and even feminine seduction is really what makes this show THE Batman that fans have come to love and movie directors try (but fail) to bring to the big screen. Also, the music, opening and background, is FANTASTIC! Really sets the mood. Warner Brothers, Zack Snyder, and CW network, you guys need to go back to these roots and do justice to the characters you guys keep ruining in your movies and TV shows!
reviews.review_header: The golden standard all Batman/DC movies should follow

reviews.review_text: CHANGE BACK TO THE ORIGINAL OPENING CREDITS!! While the intro is not very important to the plot of any episode, it SETS THE TONE for the show! The original was many times better than the adventures of superman and batman intro......FIX IT AMAZON! The first few seasons didn't do this originally on tv, so why are you doing it here?!
reviews.review_header: The original was many times better than the adventures of superman and batman intro

reviews.review_text: Everyone has "their" Batman--the Batman that is the quintessential Batman, that they grew up with and which serves as their canon for all things Batman related. I grew up during the 90's, and for me this is the definitive Batman. Dark and brooding in tone, with a fair amount of light-hearted cartoon-y humor, Batmas: the Animated Series is great! Kevin Conroy is the one true voice of Batman, and Mark Hamill will always be my favorite Joker (Heath Ledger a VERY close second). Do yourself (and your kids) a favor and check out Batman: The Animated Series, and the other shows in this genre of the DC Animated Universe--Superman, the Justice League, Justice League Unlimited, and Greg Weismann's Yoing Justice.
reviews.review_header: the Animated Series is great! Kevin Conroy is the one true voice of ...

reviews.review_text: This series holds up, in my opinion, as the BEST time-based media realization of the Batman universe/franchise. It's gorgeous, cinematic and clever. It doesn't talk down to it's audience and really lets the viewer into the psychology of the characters (essential in Batman). The animation is better-than-average and a bit of a nod to the superb Max Fleischer Superman cartoons from 1941-1943. The art direction (a mix of bauhaus, art deco and futuristic tech) is superb - if only the Batman movies were done just like this series, they would be the greatest super hero movies of all time. *The new intros on some of these episodes - replacing the dramatic opening "bank heist" scene and end credits with cheaper, "Adventures of Batman & Robin" (which they did for a tie-in into the ill-fated 1997 Joel Schumacher trainwreck) and the straight-up crappy "Batman & Superman Adventures" (presumably as a tie-in to the upcoming film or a reference to crossovers that may have happened later) - are a bummer, but they're not on EVERY episode - some retain the original, far superior intro & end credits.
reviews.review_header: Batman on the screen at it's best

reviews.review_text: I'm a bit biased due to my love for the Batman mythos but I've always felt, even upon rewatching it as an adult, that this show was fantastic. The team that put it together had involvement with the comics and knew how to tell a story in the Batman universe. The voice acting is top notch and I still think of "the" Batman or "the" Joker as Kevin Conroy and Mark Hamil respectively. In fact, Mark Hamil's joker is so revered that they've recently hired someone who could sound exactly like him to the do the voice for a recent video game. The show deals with a ton of different enemies from the Batman universe and that is what makes it so fun. The problem solving is fun to watch and the scenery is engrossing, like the comics. This team has truly put together a tremendous series and it's worth a watch. I think kids would enjoy it more these days but call me a big kid because I definitely still put it on from time to time. Swear to Kevin Conroy!
reviews.review_header: One of the best animated shows to exist!

reviews.review_text: The Dark Knight was the second of the Christopher Nolan Batman trilogy (Batman Begins/Dark Knight/Dark Knight Rises) - this review will be focusing on the 4K Upgrade rather than the movie itself. This was always a good looking movie.. but the 4K remaster makes it so much better. Of all discs I've tried, this has to be one of the best. It alternates between the film footage and IMAX footage which just pops off the screen. Grain is pretty minimal, colors and everything are great, but it does look like they raised the shadow detail as the darkest blacks were never quite black (even on an OLED TV). But everything else popped off the screen, especially with the HDR. Highly recommended upgrade. On the audio side we're also looking at DTS-HD MA 5.1 audio (no Dolby Atmos) but it's a good track still. The disc comes with a nice slipcover, the 4K Disc and a Blu-Ray + Special Features as well as a digital copy code. You can also pick this up in the Dark Knight Trilogy which has the same content (but no slipcover) or in the Christopher Nolan 4K Collection (which uses a bulky case to house all 7 Christopher Nolan movies and has no digital copy codes)
reviews.review_header: Now this.. is a beautiful movie! (4K Review)

reviews.review_text: This is one of the best if not the best 4K quality movie I've ever seen. First of all, all the IMAX scenes you get the full detail and full picture. None of those black bars. Second, the quality of this is beyond that of the Blu Ray version. The Hong Kong scenes were off the charts, and the night dark scenes were crisp and great with no washed out. Of course it helps to watch this movie with an OLED TV which I have. The only problem I had was, it doesn't have Dolby Atmos surround sound. Just DTS 5.1. The HDR was great on this movie as well
reviews.review_header: Felt like a was in an IMAX Theater. Unbelievable movie unbelievable quality.

reviews.review_text: Spectacular. Absolutely beautiful. Cinematically, this movie is one of the best ever made. Story wise - it both tells the story of a superhero and a crime-ridden city with corrupt people, a love triangle and a tragedy, the corruption of good ("you either die a hero or live long enough to see yourself become the villain"), but also the goodness of humanity that overrides even our desire for survival. There's nothing about this movie not to like. The returning and new actors are incredible - Heath Ledger as the Joker will make you crazy, but just enough so you can keep watching. Aaron Eckhart as Harvey Dent will leave you wondering, and his character is developed just enough to make his arc perfect - to keep you wondering but not shocked. Bottom line: whether you're into superheroes or not, DC Comics or Marvel, whether you've watched every Batman movie and read every comic or haven't seen a single one, this movie is well worth watching. You're probably better off watching Batman Begins first (that is incredible as well) but I don't think it's necessary. You'll just find some of the information new, which is always fantastic. And BTW, no pressure to watch The Dark Knight Rises after this. It's not a bad film but it kind of disappoints. See my review here: https://www.amazon.com/review/R3TKBV8CSCXFOE/ref=cm_cr_srp_d_rdp_perm?ie=UTF8

Just amazing. Without a doubt the best movie of all time. I've never felt so much anxiety during scenes like the Decision on the Boat or the Couple in Distress scene. And I have never seen such an immediate and well written start to a movie in my life. Soundtrack is flawless thanks to Hans Zimmer's expertise supervision. And holy crap Batman, Joker, and Harvey Dent have some of the best acting I've seen in a looooong time. Good job by Christian Bale and his master piece of a superhero movie. (thank god Joker wasn't like the one from 89 and actually has really dark undertones). 10/10, flawless movie.
reviews.review_header: The best movie of all time.

reviews.review_text: I've enjoyed all the Batman movies and TV serials, however up till now the Frank Miller comic book was the best for exploring the character. In this Batman movie however, I feel there is a whole new depth and development of Bruce Wayne, Joker, and Alfred. What makes this even better is exploration of the social-psychology of the uber-vigilante and how good and evil interact and feed off each other, and brutal honesty regarding societal needs and manipulation. This movie series is least appropriate for kids due to the psychological and stark way in which violence is portrayed.
reviews.review_header: Perhaps the best Batman character yet

reviews.review_text: Good versus evil; civilization versus barbarity; greed, corruption, human weakness; nobility, sacrifice, family, love, and what we're prepared to do for it.. The prophetic script is the strength of this work, though the acting does well enough to represent the above universal themes. This work represents the world we live in today, and asks us what we're prepared to do, to sacrifice, to keep it.
reviews.review_header: Quite simply, a masterpiece of a script.

name: Batman, "Batman in Black" Adult Comfy Throw with Sleeves, 48" x 71"

reviews.review_text: This thing is great fun! I actually ordered it to wear as a Halloween costume because we dress up as a family every year and it is NOT easy to find a modest costume, especially for plus sizes! For the sake of wearing it around the house as a blanket, it is great. It isn't heavy which is fine with me as I don't want to wear something around the house that is heavy. It is, however, verrrry long! Unless you are pretty tall, you're going to be lifting the bottom and carrying it so you don't trip. Same with use as a costume but totally worth it for the fun we had! For sitting/lying around, great! Plus my little boy said, "Mommy, you look awesome!!" :) There is no better review!
Regrettably, the gift worked too well. The recipient won't remove it from his persons. Even at the best of times. Excellent service, arrived sooner than expected and packaged with care.

I've been looking for a Harley Quinn snug-like blanket for a long time. This one is HUGE and soft. I am 5'2", 140 lbs and I'm swimming in it. A 6'2" person would fit it nicely, too. It's awesome and warm. It's officially licensed, too. A must-have for any cold Quinn fan. (The awesome hat is not included. It's mine.)

I have had a Superman version of this for years. In the last year of marriage, my wife has used it more than I have. As gifts, people have bought us Superman & Wonder Woman kitchen aprons, so I thought I'd repeat the set for our lounging attire. I gave this to my wife for her birthday. She loves it and uses it constantly! Now that the weather's getting colder, I don't have to find something else to keep me warm while we watch a movie; we've each got our own.

This was originally intended to be a birthday present for my always-freezing fiancée, but by the time it arrived (exactly on time!) I was, per usual, far too excited to wait another month to give it to him and gave it to him right away. He loves it! The material is very sturdy and soft, although definitely a bit staticky. The design is exactly as the picture, would definitely recommend for the superhero in your life!

I purchased this for my 87y.o. husband's grandma. She has Dementia and is ALWAYS cold. So I put this on her and put her pic on Facebook stating she's the OG of Wonder Woman. And people ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT! She stays warm and is happy that it goes on her ar ms with no problems!
reviews.review_header: Perfect for those with poor circulation

reviews.review_text: It's pretty cute and nice and big to cover most of you. As most people stated it's not particularly warm, but as far as snuggies go it's on the cheaper end. However, I still think it is a bit more expensive than it's worth, hence the 4 stars. Overall though, I do like using it.
reviews.review_header: It's pretty cute and nice and big to cover most of ...

reviews.review_text: As a big batman fan I was more than happy to order this. Looks great in person. It's really thin but don't let that fool you because it still keeps you VERY warm on those cold nights. I am 6 foot and this snuggle is still a bit too long to walk around in without it dragging. But overall I'm very happy with this amazing, comfy batman snuggie. :)
reviews.review_header: As a big batman fan I was more than happy to order this

reviews.review_text: Batman Begins is my favorite movie in the Nolan trilogy by far. Yes its better in my opinion than The Dark Knight because one person isn't carrying the whole movie. Liam Neeson and Bale shine in this but also Katie Holmes did a wonderful job too. Don't get me wrong I love The Dark Knight, I thought Heath's role was outstanding and that it will never be duplicated. But Heath carries the movie by himself and Bale isn't nearly as good as he is in Batman Begins. Anyway, Batman Begins shows Bruce Wayne's incredible journey to becoming Batman and ridding society of people who put fear into others. I think its the more emotional movie of the three, it also shows Bruce's fear and determination as a kid to an adult. The quality of this movie in 4k 2160P and the HDR is stunning. The mountain scenes in the beginning and the whole Vietnam scenes really pop out with the colors and detail. No IMAX scenes but the quality is still excellent especially for OLED users. You'll be able to get those natural black scenes which don't look washed. I have a LG OLED C6 65" TV and it looks incredible. The Audio is DTS HD 5.1 and Dolby Digital 5.1 Unfortunately no Dolby Atmos. I highly recommend this movie especially if you're an OLED owner.
reviews.review_header: Best Batman movie of Nolan's trilogy. Bale and Neeson shine in this movie.

reviews.review_text: First of all, forget your memories of Burton's films of Batman because this is much, much different. Christopher Nolan takes a much darker approach to Batman and tends to swerve farther away from a comic book type feel for the movie. Where Burton often used bright colors and dramatic close ups of caricatures of the infamous DC universe, Nolan takes a more subdued view of the characters and focuses on their psyches instead of their looks and over personalities. Batman Begins, quite literally, spends its time showing the audience just how Bruce Wayne developed his alter-ego and then put that other side of him into effect so that he might make Gotham City a better place. After his father died the city fell into the hands of greedy, biased, and lucrative men who allowed all of the hard work Bruce's father put into the city to fall to the wayside. Constantly filled with anger and hate for the iconic thug that killed his parents and the city's inability to hold itself up, Bruce flees. He searches for something to help him and he finds it in the idea, in the concept, in the teachings of Ra's al Ghul. However, unable to completely follow the definition of "justice" presented to him, Bruce returns to Gotham City with specialty training under his belt and a new definition of what he needs to be. What follows is a heart-stopping, action-packed thrill ride that speaks to any fan of the Batman tradition. The main villain here is Scarecrow. Just like Ra's al Ghul, he is not a well-known villain, but he definitely was part and parcel of the comics and deserves his place in the spotlight. More importantly, however, the villain in this movie is based on fear. Fear can control, can infiltrate hate, can skew logic, and can make people weak with the inability to act. Bruce suffered from fear for most of his life which turned into hate and loathing. The people of Gotham City live in fear and distress, unable to lift themselves out of the mire because of that fear. Ra's al Ghul and Scarecrow both use fear to further their means while Batman, Bruce, also taps into the fear well to be used for the better. It is the process of overcoming the psychosis of fear that makes this film so fascinating. It, like the comic books, is something we can relate to and allows us to empathize with the characters. Through this the true story of finding one's identity and fighting fear arises. A great film for the layman and for the comic book connoisseur alike.

Batman Begins was the first of the Christopher Nolan Batman trilogy (Batman Begins/Dark Knight/Dark Knight Rises) - this review will be focusing on the 4K Upgrade rather than the movie itself. This was one of the first Blu-Ray's, back when the format was competing against HD-DVD. One of the problems back then is that Warner Brothers used the same video file/bitrate as HD-DVD (which had a smaller disc size, hence a lower bitrate/higher compression was needed to make it fit). The Blu-Ray is also nearing 10 years old at this point, so it's definitely in need of an upgrade. For the 4K release, Christopher Nolan went through and did a full remaster of the release! Unfortunately, and this is possibly due to the way the film was shot, it's very hit-or-miss. Some parts of it look like an obvious upgrade while others are mediocre at best. I will say that this is the best the film has ever looked, but compared to Dark Knight or Dark Knight Rises on 4K.. it leaves some to be desired. For me, the outdoors shots looked great while indoors was a bit disappointing. The HDR, however, is a nice upgrade and probably more noticeable than the clarity. If you've never purchased the Blu-Ray (or if you're just wanting an upgrade), this is the version to get. I just wish they had gone all out with it. On the audio side we're also looking at DTS-HD MA 5.1 audio (no Dolby Atmos) but it's a good track still. The disc comes with a nice slipcover, the 4K Disc and a Blu-Ray + Special Features as well as a digital copy code. You can also pick this up in the Dark Knight Trilogy which has the same content (but no slipcover) or in the Christopher Nolan 4K Collection (which uses a bulky case to house all 7 Christopher Nolan movies and has no digital copy codes)
reviews.review_header: Batman Begins: 4K Review - Decent upgrade.. but inconsistent.

reviews.review_text: You missed out if you seen all the other Batman movies, but didn't see the original one! This original film from the sixties has a special kind of flair to it. Now, in some ways it's like a comic poke at the time period for the adults that are seeing it, while also being an exciting and funny film for kids at the same time. The movie is packed with some big names of the day: Lee Meriweather, Ceaser Romero, Burgess Meredith, etc., and they all had to have had fun making this film!
reviews.review_header: Still a Good Movie For Kids & Adults!

reviews.review_text: As a family we love it year after year it is so tongue in check hilarious! Doesn't take itself seriously like the animated versions. Casting could not be better : Burgess Meredith; Caesar Romero; Frank Goshen ; and Adam West as Batman. I'd mention them all and I would if I could remember them. (I'm the grandma) Grandkids are 6, 8 and 10 years; their father is 41. We span the decades and we all love this beautiful comedy! Don't you remember that Batman music: da-na-da-na-da-na BATMAN. Slide down the Bat Escape to the waiting Bat-winged Chrysler Imperial or the likes. Pure unreal fun! Great Color super-real fiction.

I was in high school when the original Batman TV show came on, and I can't tell you what a big deal it was. As I recall, it was broadcast 2 nights a week. The was eons of course before VCR or DVR so either you had to be there or you missed it. I think if we missed it, we would go to school and ask our friends what we'd missed. (My parents only had black and white TV in those days.) It didn't take long for the novelty to wear off, however and the TV show was canceled within a couple of years. This movie version was in theaters during that time but I don't think I ever got around to seeing it and may have seen it when they started issuing movies on VHS, which would have been in the late 70's or early 80's I saw that it's on Amazon Prime so took time to watch it and wow, is it ever dumb. But it's just like the TV show in that way. Really bad acting (supposed to be) and bad special effects and silly story. You need to see it once. That's all.
reviews.review_header: Batman............don't look for Christian Bale or Ben Affleck

reviews.review_text: Classic American production, what a great view. I would advise anyone to show the new generation this masterpiece. It reminds me of watermelon Sundays and hot summer nights when my heart was young and gay. Adam West the majestic somber faced master, with his devoted Burt Ward rallying as the perfect foil parrying and cavorting through the majestic sets of a magnificent bygone era. This movie represented the zenith of entertainment on this planet. The only series to go near it, was the Star Trek original with Captain Kirk, and the crew of the good ship enterprise, reward yourself and buy this, then purchase the box set of the complete series. I have not opened my set yet, I am still savoring the bouquet of the the haunting memories that linger within my soul.

I always liked the Batman TV show and I think it was a very smart move to make this movie with the 4 most known villains. Each one had nice parts. I've always liked the Riddler's laugh and the Joker's as well. I sure wished that Julie Newmar had been in the role of Catwoman. There's no other Catwoman like Julie Newmar. All in all the movie has it's laughs and great moments. This movie is a must have for all Batman fans of the 60's.
reviews.review_header: I always liked the Batman TV show and I think it was ...

reviews.review_text: I grew up on Adam west's Batman and still love him best❣️This movie is amazing and cheesier than a bowl of Mac n cheese! I personally love the camp factor of the '60s Batman and feel privileged to have met Adam west at a book signing. If you don't have time for the series, this movie will give you a hefty helping of it.

I never realized how very funny the writing was for the 1966 movie. I remember it being very camp (a stigma that movies about comic book heroes had to endure for some time), but having watched it again last night for the first time in many a year, I found myself laughing at a lot of its outrageous gags (one of my favorites was when they report they are just passing the Benedict Arnold Monument, like someone in America would build a monument to Arnold, LOL). The picture quality for the Blu-ray high def release is excellent, with vibrant colors and the audio is good. There are a number of extras that fill out the disc. There are two commentaries, one by screenwriter Lorenzo Semple, Jr., and the other with Adam West and Burt Ward. There is a short featurette with George Barris, creator of the Batmobile. An interactive map of locations can be played while watching the movie, and while the map spotlights can jump from Santa Barbara (for the wharf where Batman runs with the bomb) to the studio in Culver City where interiors were shot there is an option to pull up factoids, photos, and map directions to the locations. There are featurettes on the heroes and the villains, and more. All in all, a fun Blu-ray disc to purchase.
reviews.review_header: Totally enjoyable, camp movie of TV's Batman

reviews.review_text: Almost all the fun of the Batman TV Show without the commercials (sadly, no Batgirl)! Take the entire regular cast of the TV Show, add in the best villains, stir in a romance between Bruce Wayne and Catwoman with a heavy dose of camp and you have Batman: The Movie (1966). ***Spoilers May Occur Below*** When the Joker (Ceasar Romero), Penguin (Burgess Meredith), the Riddler (Frank Gorshin) and Catwoman (Lee Meriwether) join forces to steal a device that will dehydrate anything in order to kidnap the entire United World Central Committee, you know that only Batman and Robin can save the day! Not only do B&R get outwitted a few times, but Bruce Wayne falls for (and almost converts) Catwoman (disguised as Kitka). The regular hi-jinks occurs ending with, you guessed it, Batman and Robin saving the day and the world in the end--even though we do find out that Batman is not perfect in the final return of the Central Committee. Whip out the buttered popcorn, get that giant slurpee, sugar yourself up with a large movie-sized Raisinettes and Milk Duds and lay back in your easy chair to remember what it was like to go to the movies or watch Batman on the daily serialized TV Show. Same Bat Time! Same Bat Channel!
reviews.review_header: Best Camp Movie Ever to Grace the Silver Screen!

reviews.review_text: Im a huge comic book fan so naturally I like come book movies. But alot of the time comic book movies dont messure up. This time DC got it right with the director and the cast and screen writers. This is the last of the Christopher Nolan and Christian Bale batman movies ending on a epic note and the longgest runing time of all three movies. I love how all three movies mix the best batman story arcs making a begininning a middle and a end. In this epic conculsion they mix the story arc of the Knightfall series and the story of noman's land mixing both stories and making something both epic both a comic book lover and someone just enjoying a movie could love. The characters are just as good has ever ( But maybe not as good as Heath Leager's Joker). Tom Hardy as Bane is so Meneasing and a force to be reckoned with. Batman has finally met his match with Bane and the Batman in this film isnt the bad ass he was in the The Dark Knight. Batman already has his hands full with Bane he also as to deal with the catwoman( Ann Hathaway) but they never say catwoman in the movie. A epic movie to a epic set of films alot of surpises and things you wont see coming or maybe you will. Still one of the best comic book movies ever made along with the Dark Knight and The Man Of Steel. A must see for comic book fans and just plain Batman fans.
reviews.review_header: A Great Ending to a Epic Set Of Movies

reviews.review_text: Great movie, and I love how Christopher Nolan doesn't depend on CGI so much like other directors these days. Geez, it's like DC Comics are purposely doing the EXACT opposite nowadays compared to this guy's trilogy masterpiece. I mean, I can't even say that Sam Raimi's Spider-Man movies did all three awesomely. Even he had fallen in the third installment, most likely because of Sony rushing him, but still. Anyways, my review is becoming into a rambling rant, the whole point is that this is a great addition to the Batman Movie titles.
reviews.review_header: Great Addition To The Batman Movie Collection!

reviews.review_text: While not quite as good as "The Dark Knight," this movie is a very good follow-up and conclusion to the trilogy. There are definite slower parts in this one but, overall, the story line is excellent and it clocks in at an impressive 2 hours and 45 minutes. Christian Bale, Michael Caine and Morgan Freeman shine as Batman/Bruce Wayne, Alfred and Lucius Fox, respectively. Gary Oldman portrays James Gordon perfectly and Anne Hathaway was beautifully cast as Catwoman/Selina Kyle. For the dark and mercenary Bale (Tom Hardy) my only complaint about him is not his acting, but that he wears a mask and his voice is at times muffled too much and a bit hard to follow/understand. I'll not cover the plot here, as the editorial review (just above the customer review section) does that. Suffice it to say that the plot is excellent and the movie is captivating and should be in collections of anyone who enjoys a great super hero movie (along with "Batman Begins" and "The Dark Knight"). As a note, the image of the movie case (as of this writing) only says "Blu-ray Disc," but it is a multi-disc package, with the Blu-ray movie disc, the Blu-ray Special Features disc and the DVD movie disc, as well as the UV copy (my code says good until Dec 4, 2014). All of that for just 10 bucks is a fabulous deal. Four-and-a-half stars rounded up. Order. Play. Enjoy!
reviews.review_header: Very Good Follow-up To The Dark Knight and Fabulous Value

reviews.review_text: As the slogan said in the previews, TDKR IS an epic conclusion to Nolan's trilogy. I got this for a very cheap price on Cyber Monday (for a friend, I already had it) which kind of felt like I was paying less than what the movie's worth. This is an epic conclusion, and after the The Dark Knight, I was wondering how Nolan would outdo himself. He did. Furthermore, I must comment and say Hans Zimmer outdid himself. When I think of Nolan's Batman movies, the first thing I'll probably think of is Zimmer's memorable themes, and for this one, Bane's theme goes with Bane's menace. For criticisms, I give credit to "How it should have ended" - a humorous website the picks on movies... but there's a scene when Wayne returns to Gotham after a long exile, and to showcase his return to Bane, all we see is a skyscraper with the shape of a Bat on the side. Humorously, I must know, why did Wayne think that sort of project was worthwhile while the city, including his new love interest, is being held captive? Obviously the response will be to give hope to people that Batman is back, and give fright to the enemy. In any case, not entirely important. Nolan raises the stakes higher in this film, and isn't afraid to pick on movie-goer's nerves and put the main characters to their limits, and even break a few Batman-mythos rules in the process. The result is Batman more real then he's ever been. It IS an epic conclusion.

All I can say is Bane. I ask everyone who has seen both TDK & TDKR if Joker or Bane is a better villain. I don’t know. What Tom Hardy brings to this Bane version is unreal. I would never believe Bane is the same actor from Inception or This Means War. Bane’s voice, the way they use the camera to make Bane fill the lens is awesome. Catwoman is dope too. I think Anne Hathaway is dead sexy baby, yeah. I’m not sure if the Batman movies will ever be redone. Maybe never, maybe not for a long time, maybe soon. Who knows. That said, this is an a great ending to a new style. Well played Mr. Nolan. The opening sequence to TDK was sweet. The opening sequence to TDKR was somehow even better. Pick this one up. Great action, great takes on some old great characters and some old not so great characters.
reviews.review_header: Will There Be Another Batman Take?

name: DC Comics Batman Guys Pajama Pants

reviews.review_text: I'm a women first and foremost, I'm pretty small in height but curvy the pants which are men's fit me great their confortable, soft and totally awesome. Thank you very much. Not really helpful for guys but us ladies don't always agree with form fitting pants all the time.

I am a 4'10 85 lb female and I ordered the xsmall and they fit how I like to wear my comfy pants perfectly. Fit around the waist great and were a little longer which I like bc I don't like my comfy pants directly at my ankles, I like there to be a little extra fabric. The fabric feels comfy too. I just got them though so I don't know yet of they will shrink, fade, or the lettering will come off when I wash them.

Great fit but lousy thread. Slight tugs and I hear threads breaking. I’m not stressing the fabric at all so the thread is very brittle. The pockets are ridiculous. They’re so thick, it deforms the shape and is super noticeable. 3 stars because Batman.
Batman PJs? Are you kidding? Who WOULDN'T want these? And they're SO comfortable! Love them!!! My wife thinks I'm a dweeb when I wear them but I love them!!!

The size isn’t the issue. It’s the product. I ordered a small and a medium of the same item and they are totally different. The logo and letters on the small are much bigger and brighter than the medium. I tried to reorder the medium again thinking it was a mistake and got the same item again today. Like WTH! I don’t want some faded looking pants. Like seriously. I want what’s advertised. Although it doesn’t look faded in the photo but compared to the smaller size the medium size looks horrible. I’ll be sending them back.
My husband loves them! They fit perfectly. Very comfortable too.
reviews.review_header: Great lounge pants for a batman man!

reviews.review_text: Super cozy PJ pants. These Batman pant fit as expected. I have washed these several times and the logo going down the leg still looks great. The pants are soft cotton and not at all rough against the skin.
our son wears these the minute he gets home from work. loves them
reviews.review_header: 35 year old son loves them, haha! who knew!

reviews.review_text: Having never seen the original graphic novel, I have to say I was highly impressed by this adaptation. It's three hours long of pure, compressed awesome as Batman makes a comeback in Gotham City with a vengeance. And while he is older, Batman has lost none of his skills and determination, settling old scores one by one. Aside from strong action sequences, the movie also has some powerful themes running through it, particularly how it satirizes our media and way of life. Batman's activities and those of his enemies are commented on by a 24/7 news circus, led by a variety of talking heads that are all too often very opinionated but completely clueless. Far from dated, that commentary seems more relevant than ever. Today we live in a 24/7 news cycle, bombarded with information, but most of it's useless at best, misleading at worst. Another theme is authority figures abdicating said authority by failing to act when it's needed. Only Batman is willing to make the hard choices that will keep other people safe and restore order, but unfortunately this, more than anything else, makes him public enemy #1. Is it appropriate to resort to vigilantism when our leaders fail us, or is it better to stand by them for the sake of public order? Batman seems to prefer the former, and it's hard to argue with the results. The characters in the movie are all very interesting, with striking visual designs. The Mutants are a bunch of savages that babble slang from behind the multitudinous neon red glow of their visors, and led by a monstrous leader that probably is, in fact, a mutant. The Joker, in contrast to his usual lanky, disheveled appearance, looks nearly unphased by age and seems stronger than ever. There's Carrie, the girl Robin, who adds a desperately needed splash of bright color to Gotham's grim world, and her enthusiasm is infectious. And of course, there's the Batman, whose strong jaw and muscular bulk mark him as a force to be reckoned with. The voice-overs are all top-notch, too. The Joker's lines are delivered with an unnerving, almost feminine tone as he gleefully rampages about. Peter Weller's Batman is great, too. I know some people would want Kevin Conroy but Weller is just fine, here. This Batman needed to be someone who could come off as both a thinker and a leader, and Weller's strong voice pulled that off, though I have to admit that, when he said, "I am the law!" I couldn't help but get Robocop flashbacks. It's not entirely perfect, though. While the animation is good, some of the special effects, especially fog or smoke, look cheap and out of place beside the animated characters. I also felt the movie was way too hard on "President," who's obviously supposed to be Reagan--and the irony is that, while it was cool to poke fun at Reagan back then, these days, well after the publication of the original graphic novel, politicians from both parties are quick to try and compare themselves to him. So much for that bit of satire. And you may find this movie portrays some classic characters in ways you might be unused to, to say the least. Some scenes, especially with Superman and the Joker, are very disturbing, and I would even go so far as to say Heath Ledger's Joker was restrained compared to the one we have here. The movie caps off with a few hours of documentaries, but while some of them are fairly interesting, they can be safely skipped, because otherwise you're looking at a five hour movie--geeze! Hey, DC! How about a sequel, huh? Because The Dark Knight Strikes Again was... uh... well... hm. You know what, let's leave this saga at this satisfying conclusion. Frank Miller probably should have.

This 3 hour long animated film is based on the excellent graphic novel by Frank Miller. It stars a jaded, cynical, and brutal Batman who decides to return to fight crime in Gotham after retiring for several years. Along the way he goes up against the likes of Two Face, Joker, and of course, Superman. What makes this film so extraordinary besides the stellar voice cast is that it truly provides an excellent insight into the psyche of Batman. It also has an epic score with an incredible main theme. The animation is also top notch with several standout scenes showing just how brutally effective the vigilante still is in his old age. This is the story that Batman v Superman drew heavily on, so if you liked that interpretation of Batman, you will thoroughly enjoy this movie. Superman is also really well portrayed and has none of his self doubt issues from Dawn of Justice. As the headline states, I truly believe this is the best Batman film ever made, animated or otherwise.

Dude! Dude! Watch this movie. It was amazing! The ending, the action, the villains - wow. I did not read the comic, but this is by far the best batman movie I've ever seen (if you've seen anything that tops this then please leave a comment - I want to watch it). "Year One" was interesting, and more about Jim Gordon. These two movies (which don't break in between) were, together, the best batman movies I'd ever seen. He's not a clean cut superhero, but he does what he has to do. He's clever, witty, ingenious - just perfect. SPOILER ALERT : The Arrow makes an appearance, and so does the Joker. Watch this one through. It will make you wonder why these few animated DC gems aren't the ones released into theaters, and the terrible live action ones are. It wasn't perfect, but for those of you who have somewhat kept up with the Batman's story (like myself) will find this movie to be a sort of closure to his legacy. I thoroughly enjoyed it and I hope you will too. This puts the new dc 52 movies to shame. In fact I plan to never watch any of them unless they can top or match this movie set; a well-spent $14.99.

If you are thinking about buying this collection of the '66 Batman series, you probably know what you are getting. I find that there are only two camps when it comes to the old Batman TV series: either you love it, or you hate it. There doesn't seem to be any middle ground. Yes, it's campy. Yes, it's cheesy. No, the writers were never going to win an award for tight dialogue and engrossing mysteries. But if you liked it way back when, watching the '66 Batman is like a stroll down memory lane. I probably owe my love a Batman, and superheroes in general, to the reruns of this show that I watched every afternoon during the 90s. Having the first season on DVD is loads of fun, and I can't wait until my son is old enough to watch it with me.

I'm biased as I was a child when this was on TV. I grew up with it. Now as an adult in see the camp and subliminal humor that was threaded in the fabric of this show. Very fun and silly. If you like camp and old fashioned cliff hanger soap style tv, then you'll love it. If you want a tougher than nails dark Batman figure, you wont.
reviews.review_header: Same Bat Time, Same Bat Channel!!!!

reviews.review_text: Okay so I wanted to relive my Freshman year of High School, Me in my cheerleading outfit gyrating to the Theme from Batman as played by the Warren High School Marching Band (occasionally out of tune) and our team crushing the Downey Ducks! I did. Good memories.

Best show ever! I love these. Classic episodes on this disc that are so campy, yet still decent villains and good creative episodes. This season has a good mix of classic villains (joker, catwoman, etc.) and random cameo villains. Great season and I strongly recommend for anyone looking to entertain family with a hilarious old tv show. The escapes are always so creative.
reviews.review_header: Great season of batman. Strongly recommend for any fan

reviews.review_text: Not Amazon's fault. Been wanting Batman on stream for years. Now in HD, the best I have ever seen my series growing up as a kid where being Good was countered with spanking if you weren't. The 1960s brought back with this series. The Green Hornet would be cool too. Well the picture, and the ease this plays on all my devices is the hallmark of why I love Amazon streaming. HD especially really makes the image sharp and clear. Color is excellent with the villains and cape crusaders at the vibrant best. Stories out right silly, but that is why it is fun.
reviews.review_header: the best I have ever seen my series growing up as ...

reviews.review_text: My kids love watching this and with all the other crap on TV I don't mind them watching this over some of the awful kids shows. I will likely be buying more seasons. The only draw back is that they have come out with some collectors items from this batman show and they cost a lot of money and my kids think they are toys and want them saying "that is the real batmobile" and not the actual toy one that cost $10!!!
reviews.review_header: Great show for batman loving kids

reviews.review_text: I already own the Complete Blu-ray set, but I wanted this, the first season to watch digitally whenever I want to. This season was the one in which the BATMAN TV show hit its peak, it had the right balance of comedy, action, and suspense, without letting the camp elements overwhelm the Series. I admit that I'm more of a fan of the Dark Knight version of the Batman character, especially any story in which there are no sidekicks floating around, but this version is appropriate for all ages, and I think that's for the best.
reviews.review_header: and I think that's for the best.

reviews.review_text: Let me say right off the bat (pun intended) that this series is extremely campy and cartoon like. I would not recommend this for adult consumption. However, my grand kids (ages 3-9) love the show and often request it. If truth be told the series has a classic charm to it and is a fond remembrance from my childhood.
reviews.review_header: Very campy but charming for children

name: Spy Gear - Batman Ultimate Utility Belt Bundle

reviews.review_text: Junk and expensive at that. The gadgets don't work in most cases and are very difficult to take off or put back on the belt. Speaking of the belt it is HUGE! Not designed for a child as it fits my waist which is an adult male 32. Avoid this product at all costs! Just another rip off Batman themed piece of junk being targeted towards children in order to make a quick buck before parents figure out the quality is so low level it shouldn't even be sold for a quarter of the price it is being offered for. Amazon should remove this product from their website and refund every single person that bought it on principle alone. If there was a 0-star rating or even a negative star rating I would be more than happy to award this steaming pile of crap the worst product review in history. Please do yourselves and your kids a big favor and look elsewhere.
reviews.review_header: Avoid this product at all costs, buyer beware!

reviews.review_text: This would be a great product had it been around $20. Seeing that the price is more around the $50 range I would expect it not to break within the first hour of use. It's made cheaply and the gadgets light up but really don't do much else.

This item does not look as it does on the box. The batman symbol is not yellow. Also the gear is very difficult to put on and take off the belt. This product looks great but not a great item for a budding 5 year super hero
reviews.review_header: This product looks great but not a great item for a budding 5 ...

reviews.review_text: This belt was too expensive for how cheap the "utilities" are. The flashlight never worked and the other things are very cheap. My 5 year old son could easily overlook these things except the belt wouldn't fit on his waist. There isn't a way to adjust it to fit him so the whole toy is basically useless. Very disappointing toy.
Cheap plastic toys. Most of it quit working after about a week, but my son liked it while it lasted
reviews.review_header: Fun while it lasted (which wasn’t long)

reviews.review_text: This is a pile of junk. The only thing that really even works is the flashlight and the battery cover has a stripped out screw, so that had to be taped shut.
