reviews.review_text: Pressed the submit button and nothing happened? Don't know if went through or not! Not going to fill it out all again!

name: Batman Missions Batman Voice Changer Helmet

reviews.review_text: Our grandson was in 7th heaven
Why the heck did I get this? Why the heck do I think it's cool? Why the heck do I put it on while doing work? I'm Batman! (not even close) but wish I were.

This is cool mask for any Batman fan (though my three year old Batman lover is terrified of this thing. Lol.) It is a solid plastic, it looks like the Christian Bale Batman (or maybe Ben Affleck-- I haven't seen any of the Justice League movies.) Anyways, it's the gritty realistic looking Batman, not the cartoon-y style Joel Schumacher or Adam West Batmans. It has a pretty solid strap to keep it on your head (a vertical and horizontal strap). It is adjustable and fits small kids (my terrified three year old) and older kids. It has two sliding mouthpiece halves that cause the mask to make noise or say catchphrases when you move them. They make like batarang noises or have Batman saying things like ,"Two Face!" My one criticism is that this mask is super loud. (The speaker is on the front of the helmet.) There is no way to make it quieter. That would be my one wish for this mask. Let's take it down a notch, Batman.

I picked this up for my nephew but I have been having so much fun with it myself (the masks size and adjustable harness make this easily worn by an adult.) the sound effects and sayings are hilarious but the voice changer is what makes it. (Raspy giggling makes it hard to stop.) The mask is really well made, and pretty solid and the straps are nylon much like tie downs are made from. I wouldn’t get it wet since it could easily mess up the voice box which is actually in the forehead of the mask.
reviews.review_header: Made for either kids or adults

reviews.review_text: Okay, our cosplay loving 8-year-old adores this. He has played with it for hours, especially the voice changer. Since he is eight, he doesn't have a deep voice which makes the voice changer adapt him to a very strange voice, more clown like than Batman to be sure. Sounds like the villain stole Batman's mask. When we prompted him to speak deeper it actually did well with sounds more Batman like, but most kids are not going to achieve that affect. However they will definitely achieve a strange voice and they will love that anyway. So a win for that. He also likes the built in sounds and that the mask is heavier duty than others he has owned. This make makes him think it is a toy for grown-ups, not for kids, which makes it cooler. It was also nice that the batteries were included in this so it worked right out of the box. He is already planning to wear this for Halloween since the voice changer is so much fun and can be creepy, too. This is a kid who ADORES masks and cosplay. I don't think he will ever outgrow that love so this mask will last him for a few years if he doesn't lose it or break it.

So...this was for a four year old. Who thought it was MODERATELY fun until daddy put it on and was tremendously scary. Now it isn't a toy anymore. It's nightmare fuel. The straps adjusted to fit just fine (on both), but daddy says that the mask gets pretty warm inside. It probably is less of an issue for a kid (their heads are going to fit better), but it doesn't breathe well. The voice modulator works fine. It doesn't make the 4 year old sound like Batman at all, but it does make daddy sound raspy, like an alcoholic smoker who got woken up for guard duty a few hours too early. Grindy. The prerecorded noises are fine, if a bit boring. All told, this might be a gem once we forget about daddy wearing it.
reviews.review_header: Gets really warm inside...plastic breathes poorly

reviews.review_text: POW! WOW!!! For kids? Yes, and for ANY kid getting this, it's crazy great. Mask is a battery-operated host of sound effects. Mouthpiece closing goes CLINK! CLINK! as the sides shut over the mouth; slide forward for another sound effect, slide back for "I must save Gotham City from the Joker!" and many more. Safe (Mattel is toy God) and essy to put on and off (straps are elastic). Even my 64 year old inner kid thought, "WOWWWW!" I LOVE THIS!
reviews.review_header: Talking, noise-making Batman mask is insanely cool!

reviews.review_text: IM BATMAN! is what the kiddos will be screaming once they don this well made mask with sound effects and a movable mouth piece that opens and shuts. Kids will line up (maybe some adults) to be the next one to wear this mask if you bring it to a party. I do have to say that I found the mask to be too small for the average adult to use comfortably. An adult can wear this, it's just not going to be very comfortable after 2 minutes. The mask has adjustable soft nylon bands in the back to fit any childs head. If you have a little Batman enthusiast running around your house, get them this mask and watch their jaws drop!
reviews.review_header: A HIT with the kids! Cool mask with sound

name: Fisher-Price Imaginext DC Super Friends, Wayne Manor Batcave

reviews.review_text: Item was well taken care of. Just be sure that if you're ordering this as an early Christmas shopping gift, you'd probably want to go to the store and buy the BOXED version.
reviews.review_header: Item is Unboxed - Still a Good Item

reviews.review_text: Great great product
This is a Christmas gift and it arrived intact and inside plastic covering so weather wouldn’t ruin it and I’m super stoked! The 5 yr old will love it!
Great Toy, and it comes assembled. The toy is huge lol so worth the money my son been asking for it for a while now . I actually got it on sale for Black Friday.
Fisher price is always great
Product looked just like the picture and came pretty quickly

At the outset, let me say that we are very much an Imaginext family. Ever since my ten-year-old was a toddler, we have been collecting bits and pieces from a variety of interchangeable Imaginext sets. We love the fact that the figures all work together across different playsets, so there are big opportunities for creative play. We have more Batman sets and figures than any other, but we love to combine them with our other Imaginext toys: Jurassic World, Power Rangers, Monsters Inc., city and space sets. We have an older Bat Cave playset in our collection, and at first we thought that this would be an unnecessary duplicate. But in fact, this "Wayne Manor" set actually works very well as a companion piece to the more elaborate Bat Cave we have separately. Wayne Manor is very gothic and castle-like, with a lot of dark plastic rock work. We love the plastic waterfall that can open and close, and the pop-up and light-up Bat Signal is just awesome and the exact kind of feature I would have wanted on a Bat Cave toy when I was a kid. The spin-around glider is a nice feature, though not quite as interesting since it only goes in a circle, and the now-standard Imaginext disc launcher and jail cell are pretty much mandatory in any action playset of this size. We were pleased to see a Bat Cycle included here, even though we already have a couple, and the Batman figure is somewhat different than our (older) ones from other sets. I don't quite understand why Batman comes with a huge sword, but my kids certainly enjoy using it for one-sided sword fights. All in all, this is an excellent addition to any Imaginext collection, or even on its own (despite only coming with a Batman figure), it would be appreciated by any little Batman fan.
reviews.review_header: A fun and interactive "Wayne Manor" and Bat Cave set

reviews.review_text: The batcave sets are definitely smaller than the previous years, but I remember paying more than this for the big batcave we had for our son who's now eleven. I like the fact that they keep doing things a little different, so even if you have previous batcaves that you have something new. This one has a disc shooter, a crane that flies batman around, a waterfall door, a jail, the bat signal, the bat computer, etc. There's stuff to do in every corner of the set. I also really like the bat motorcycle it comes with. I think the waterfall door is very creative too. When the batcaves first came out, there were few imaginext superhero sets. Now it seems like every other set is somethign superhero. I still think the batcave ones are some of the best!
reviews.review_header: The Batman sets continue to be some of the best imaginext sets

name: Paladone Batman Travel Mug Logo Products Comics Calici Tazze
LEGO DC Super Heroes Batman: Brother Eye Takedown 76111 Building Kit (269 Piece)

reviews.review_text: Great addition to collection
Son loves this LEGO
Liked
Excellent set as expected

My son loves this set, and because of the addition of the Batwoman minifigure (thank you Lego…) my daughter does, too! (It’s rare that I can buy a superhero Lego set that is as appealing to both my children, so this is a nice find.) The set is also at reasonable price point, with two main “vehicles”, the jet, and the robot, which allows this set to be played buy more than one child (which is very nice!) It also has multiple unique bat pieces in the form of decorations for the jet, bat-wings for the jet, as well as bat-shields and batarangs that the good guys can use to defend themselves against the bad guys -a cool looking blue cyclops looking minifigure along with a giant “eye” robot. This baddie is pretty nice -it comes with a special light brick and has talons and grippers with which to attack the good guys. (More importantly, as a parent, it comes with the batteries needed to use this light brick… THANK YOU!) Finally, the bat-jet has a couple of “shooters” which my son absolutely loves… —where were these on my Legos when I was a kid? As a result, I think this is a very fun set, at a nice price point, and equally enjoyable by either girls or boys. Recommended.
reviews.review_header: You can’t go wrong with the Bat-jet!

reviews.review_text: LEGO DC Super Heroes Batman: Brother Eye Takedown 76111 Building Kit (269 Piece) My son enjoys his Legos and this set is no exception. Has plenty of interesting pieces and of course the minfigs are a huge hit. Seems like no matter your age if you are a true Lego lover you never outgrow them. I like that every set comes with great step by step directions so that if one is too young is easy enough for an adult to help out along the way. This set is so great for any Batman fan I mean has a Batplane how can you go wrong there. The minifigs are Batman , Batwoman and OMAC. My son likes to build and then put his sets on display in his room
reviews.review_header: Perfect for either Lego fan or Batman fan

reviews.review_text: This is a fun and easy to build set. You get Batman, Batwoman, and OMAC. You get a Batwing and Satellite. This Batman has a 5 o'clock shadow! The set is fun and looks great on display. This is the first time I have seen a light up brick from Lego. The batteries are included. The set for an adult is super simple to build. My kids are way too small for something this complicated, but they "helped" and love playing with this set. I love Lego and comic books so this is a win-win!
reviews.review_header: It's LEGO and It's Batman. Win Win

reviews.review_text: This is a great little set with Batwoman. The Batman with Grey suit is a bit of a step down from his Batman movie sets with the yellow belt mid-section, but overall still good. The construction is not hard, but not super easy and some little folks might need occasional help. This will depend on your little one's level of building , etc. All in all a fun set that remind me of an earlier smaller bat plane with updated styling.

name: LEGO DC Super Heroes Batman: The Attack of the Talons 76110 Building Kit (155 Piece)

reviews.review_text: My 10 year old grandson is an enthusiastic fan of both Lego and Batman, so this item was a slam dunk gift. He builds the Lego sets and then displays the completed project on his bedroom shelf. This is one of his favorites, and that's saying something considering his extensive collection.
Came on time no damage, our pieces were there. This was our first Lego set and the instructions were good as easy to put together .
Shipping was super fast and my cousin loves legos!

The biggest struggle that I have with this set is whether Ace the Bat-Hound should have been released in a Lego Juniors set -- one that is targeted for younger builders. Lego seems to have really wanted to release the Ace the Bat-Hound figure and it didn't matter where. I am clearly not giving Ace the Bat-Hound enough credit, but if I'm Batman and I'm rolling on my over-sized three-wheel motorbike against two Talon Assassins, maybe I don't bring the Bats best friend. This set almost panders to collectors. Get the Ace the Bat-Hound figure. Get another new Batman fig. Get pearl gold weapons - two kitanas, two (Wolverine-style) claws, two Bat shields, two Bat-tle axes (like what I did there?) and three Bat-erang type weapons. Plus three pearl gold bat badges for the vehicle. And...uhhhh....get one huge three-wheeled motor bike that is nothing like any Batman vehicle in your collection. The recent trend to show Batman at his most vulnerable continues with this minifig. He looks like the two Talon Assassins are giving him all he can handle and they've managed to break the mask he wears under his cowl. He has a double-sided face and the one I describe isn't shown in the product photos. He has weird shoulder pads, but everyone loves a new Batman figure. I am not familiar with the Talon Assassins, but they apparently represent the Court of Owls and have been part of Batman for over 50 years, so they are fun to add to the collection. Though, I still believe that their weapons will be more prized than the figures themselves. The bike is too big. Mom or Dad will buy this set because they want the new figures and weapons and they will build the bike for a child to try to make up for stealing the figures and weapons. I'm not saying that is what I did personally. Just a guy I know... I love the Ace the Bat-Hound figure. He is placed prominently among my Batmen.
reviews.review_header: Ace the Bat-Hound is clearly the star of this set.

reviews.review_text: LEGO DC Super Heroes 76110 Batman: The Attack of the Talons contains 155 pieces, three minifigures, and retails for $19.99 USD. The Batman minifigure in this set is equipped with Heavy Armor, and this is the first time this version has appeared in any set. He comes with a plethora of Bat-themed weapons, including Batarangs, shields, etc. The other two minifigures are "Talons", members of The Court of Owls. This is their first appearance in a LEGO Batman set which is quite exciting. They are equipped with gold katanas and Wolverine claws. Another figure (not considered a minfigure) is included in the set, which is Ace The Bat-Hound, who hasn't appeared in a set before, so his inclusion is most welcome here. He comes with a cape. The main build of this set is a three-wheeled vehicle for Batman to drive, which doesn't have much to it in terms of play functions, although there are stud shooters and storage for weapons on the side. There is a sticker on the front of the vehicle. I like this set, although the vehicle build is quite odd and I don't feel like it's something Batman would use. What really makes this one shine though are the figures, all four of which are exclusive to this set. Definitely recommended to any LEGO Batman fan or minifig collector!

This is another great Lego set. The brand "Lego" speaks for itself--high quality, fun, and long-lasting. Lego sets and pieces can be used interchangeably. Once your done building this set, you can break it down and re-build it again or combine the pieces from this set with another set or individual legos to make your own creation. This set comes with 4 super hero figures. It also comes with a few weapons. I wish that it didn't come with the weapons, as they really aren't needed to make the set fun. Be cautious when playing with and building the set around small children, as there are many small pieces that can be a chocking hazard. The weapons and figures are small enough to swallow--as are many of the lego pieces. I forgot to mention the Batmobile that comes with the set. It's really fun to build and even more fun to push around. What a bonus!
reviews.review_header: Very Fun Set for Any Super Hero Lover!

reviews.review_text: This is a nice inexpensive Batman set with two things that I think really define it: Batman has a really cool suit, and there is a Bat-dog. Okay, let’s be honest, the main thing about this $20 set is the Bat-dog. My daughter has already stolen it and my son has to keep asking her for it to play with. The set itself is rather simple -just a three wheeled bat-vehicle with two bad guy ninja minifigures, and Batman and a Bat-dog, but it has a lot of nice bat decorations (for the vehicle) and bat shields/batarang. One of the bat guys has Wolverine-like claws and the other one has a couple of samurai swords. For $20 you really can’t ask too much, and the availability of a vehicle and a few special mini figures at this price is really nice. This makes a great (and affordable) stocking stuffer.
reviews.review_header: It has a "bat-dog"... a "BAT-DOG"... where else are you going to find this in an inexpensive set?

reviews.review_text: I gave this to my Batman Fanatic daughter (age 12), and here's her feedback: "I really like this set. It's movable, nice-looking, and comes with lots of golden chrome weapons and a little dog. My complaints are: 1. The back wheel. If you don't get it perfectly aligned on its LEGO Technic axle, it scrapes against the arch that goes over the wheel, and it won't turn right. So you end up having to practically drag the vehicle across the floor. 2. It's not very sturdy. I was tiptoeing across the floor, and I accidentally bumped the car. It totally fell apart, and I had to spend the next half an hour putting it back together. Other those little complications, I think it's a really nice LEGO set."
reviews.review_header: Fun doggy, and chrome weapons, but a little fragile

name: LEGO Superheroes App-Controlled Batmobile Building Kit, Multicolor

reviews.review_text: Great model, as control response.
So fun for young boys
Love my Batman !!

Build: Comes with a Batman minifig which is slightly different from the original Lego movie minifig. Extremely detailed and sturdy overall. Small pieces and wheels tend to fall off but easy to replace. The wires are integrated well and it's easy to access the Bluetooth and battery compartment. It takes 6 AAA batteries which is ridiculous. The stud shooters are manual so they're fairly useless because you have to go over to the batmobile to launch the studs. There's not much to play with when you're not using the app. The car can't roll without the motors, so if you're not controlling it with the app/batteries, it just sits there. I guess you could shoot the studs. App: The app is free and has two sets of controls. It takes a long time to pair your device sometimes and tends to quit unexpectedly. This new feature of Lego is definitely its own league. It's super cool and awesome and the recordings of Batman talking are really fun. The car is extremely maneuverable and speedy.
reviews.review_header: Pretty awesome new line of Lego

reviews.review_text: I had high expectations for this set, and this set topped them. The build itself is pretty straightforward, but the car performs exceptionally well. It is agile, responsive, and has two variable speed motors that go forwards and backwards. It needs 6 AAA batteries that all go in the receiver, which then sends power to the motors. The variable speed and separate controls for each motor allow you to move slowly, fast, turn backwards or forwards, go in a large or small circle, or even spin in place! The car is controlled using the LEGO Powered Up app running on a smartphone or tablet.It controls the car via bluetooth and works quite well. The app has 2 drive modes; one is smoother and you have more control, the other is easier to use. You might want to ensure your device can run that app to avoid disappointment, as no other remote is included with this set. The app also works with a couple of train sets, 60197 Passenger Train and 60198 Cargo Train, but those also include a remote. We don't have one so don't know if it would work with this car. The app is better though because it has a lot of buttons for preset patterns, such as back up and turn around, or zig zag, etc. These are quick movements that could be challenging to replicate manually. The motors and bluetooth receiver could easily be used in a custom build for all sort of things. For example, it would work to sync two smartphones to their own custom cars and have a demolition derby. The included Batman minifigure is very detailed and so far is exclusive to this set. He easily fits into the spacious and fancy driver's cabin. The car is fairly low to the ground so struggles in grass, and quickly picks up stuff on the axles on my carpet - but being LEGO it is super easy to take apart and clean. There were some extra bat shaped pieces included different from any in the build. This is a really cool and unique set that opens up whole new possibilities for custom LEGO projects! Great for kids and adults. Highly recommended!
reviews.review_header: Very agile and responsive variable speed remote control car

reviews.review_text: A very neat set that sort of hops in between trying to be a normal Legos set but not quite as involved as a full blown Technics set. A fun build that becomes even more fun when you download the app and control the Batmobile like a RC car. A neat little Lego set.
reviews.review_header: A neat bridge between Lego and Technics

reviews.review_text: My son put this together in a few hours, the instructions were straightforward and easy to follow. The app control worked well on his iPhone and he was zipping the batmobile around his bedroom and having a lot of fun with it. The fact that it's LEGO means that he can rebuild it and reconfigure it any way he wants. I think it's a little pricey but it's a lot of fun.
reviews.review_header: Fun to build and to play with

reviews.review_text: The new Lego City Trains and this Batmobile have begun using an iOS and Android app called Powered Up. If you are used to the boxes that have batteries inside motorized vehicles, they look or are the same. The difference here is that the remotes are now gone in favor of this new app used on your device. No more batteries for your Lego remotes and no more Lego remotes on different frequencies and you aren't sure which one controls which train, etc. The Build: Very straight-forward as it only has 321 pieces. Took about 40 minutes. The Batman figure here is very detailed and interesting and is clearly a jewel of this set. Because it's a remote controlled vehicle that could be bumping in to things, the item is very solidly built and does not break easily. Using it as a remote controlled vehicle: It connects via Bluetooth. Press and hold the button at the top and Voila it connects. The menu has two options at the moment which are Lego City and Batman. After that, you can see the picture of the control portion of the app I took. Each slider moves the right or left wheel and that's how you turn it. You can do wheelies, go fast or slow, or backward. The range is about the typical for Bluetooth maybe 60-70 feet. The engine has good torque and can go up hills and drive over small items. My son has had a lot of fun playing with this item, more than a normal Lego set. Given the remote function, I think it could be a staple for awhile. I wish it were priced at $90. Because it's Lego of course you can customize it or add your own figs to it. Lego did a nice job with this one.
reviews.review_header: A quick build, but hours and hours of playtime

reviews.review_text: The invoices are extremely confusing and when we go to pay it is for items we purchased a few months prior which normally isn't bad, but can be when we get to the end of the fiscal year. Also the first page tends to list more items then what the total payment due box says which is confusing. Only list on that page what has to be paid for. Lastly, for our account purposes we need the itemized invoice for what is being paid for in the current invoice. Currently I have to find the previous months invoice to get the itemized list so I can pay the current month's invoice. So in other words, the amount that is due should also have the itemized invoice in the following pages in addition to the other active charges. I can't pay for an item if I can't code it in our budget and I shouldn't have to flip between different invoices from different months to figure it out. Keep it simple. These are the only invoices I have ever seen created in such a convoluted way. Every other invoice I handle is clear about what is being paid for accept this one.
reviews.review_header: ... we purchased a few months prior which normally isn't bad, but can be when we get to the ...

reviews.review_text: While the credit line is a convenience, the invoicing as it is handled by the third-party servicing provider is cumbersome to use. Product descriptions are truncated on the purchase detail provided. This makes it necessary for me to frequently take the extra step to research our purchases on our account in order to be able to code them. There is no total provided on the statement, again adding an extra step so I can be sure I am paying the correct amount. Since I opened the revolving credit line knowing it needed to be paid in full each month, I don't understand the point of checking off the boxes next to each purchase in order to be sure they are credited to the account. I feel with the sophisticated and impressive technology typically employed by Amazon, this style of invoicing is....inconsistent.
reviews.review_header: While the credit line is a convenience, the invoicing ...

reviews.review_text: Even though both my SS and DOB are correctly entered I kept getting the same below as encountered by other reviewers. Error message: "Your response to following fields is invalid Date of Birth can not be less than 8 characters. Social Security Number can not be less than 9 characters."
reviews.review_header: Don't waste your time filling out the form!

reviews.review_text: An absolute must for businesses, churches, etc. I pastor a small church which has a relatively low maximum on our business credit card. Amazon's corporate credit line gave me a very generous maximum credit line, allowed us to be sales tax exempt because we are a non-profit, and it is so simple to make a purchase. We can either use a P.O. Number or just our line of credit. A nicely detailed statement comes in the mail and I verify and approve it and turn it over to our treasurer/accountant for payment. I love it! Easiest way to purchase what we need, receive it with Amazon's always speedy shipment, and settle up when the statement comes in. If you have a church or business and don't have this you are missing out.
reviews.review_header: A nicely detailed statement comes in the mail and I verify ...

reviews.review_text: It's the easiest way to to have a business account associated with your personal account. This way you can pick and choose which account you want your purchase charged to. Only annoying thing is that the "Corporate" option will not show up as a payment option unless you choose the business address for delivery. I understand that's a security feature to protect against fraud but in our situation it's unnecessary and an annoyance. Other than that, no complaints.

The site does not work I too am having problems all fields are correct. It comes back and says that SS need to be 9 numbers. Then it says that the Birthdate has to be at least 8 numbers. It does not show any errors but never able to complete the application online.

I like the convenience of ordering things and paying in full. I do not like the way it is set up however. There is an order number when you order but on the credit card statement there is an invoice number and nothing to tie the two together except the amount and listed items. This makes it hard to reconcile the orders with the bill. It takes too much time to figure out. The billing seems to be lag behind quite a bit. We only pay bills once a month so it makes it difficult to make sure all invoices are paid. The statement doesn't reach us until after the deadline for our monthly bills.
reviews.review_header: love the convenience, BUT not the billing cycle

reviews.review_text: Wish there was a mechanism to have items categorized, such as book, video, video game, office supply, etc. Even if I could input that information when I ordered, it would help with my budget. As it is, I need to go through every invoice (lots) and try to determine which it is and then, if I can't remember, I need to look it up. It is essential to have this broken down for line items within our budget.

name: Regalo My Cot Portable Toddler Bed, Includes Fitted Sheet and Travel Case, Royal Blue

reviews.review_text: I bought this in preparation for a move from Germany back to the US. I wanted to get it ahead of time to let our daughter get used to it, since all of our furniture would be packed up and on a boat for a loooong time. I had her take naps in it at home instead of her crib (13-14 months old) and for date nights, I would bring it to the babysitter's house. It fit easily in our big luggage for the flight back to the US and it wasn't heavy at all. It fit perfectly under the "desk" built into our hotel room and you can see Chloe didn't have an issue sleeping on it. She was able to crawl up on down from it with no problem. She does tend to...migrate...when she sleeps, so we would put blankets or pillows down if the floor wasn't carpeted. I would and have recommended this to friends and family. Pic 1 - 15 months old (babysitter's house) Pic 2 - 17 months old (hotel in Germany) Pic 3 - 18 months old (hotel in US) Pic 4 - 21 months old (in our new home!)

This cot is perfect for my 2 year old and she could probably use it up to the age of 8 or so, but it does take some work to make it comfy. Like most cots it's terribly uncomfortable so I bought a foam pad from Walmart for $9 and then covered it with an extra sheet and it seems to do the trick! My little one was so excited when she saw it. We bought the pink one and I love that it comes in a cute pink carrying bag! So easy to set up, they even sent us a little pink sheet cover which was awesome, I put the foam pad on than the pink cover and then a simple crib sheet. So far we are happy! It's a better choice than a kids air mattress because those things can be so overpriced! I've heard some people say that the cot will close up because you do have to pull it out, I wish there was some kind of latch that I could hook on the bars to make it more stable like, but I've never had it just close on my child or anything, but my little one knows to not stand or jump on this, it's strictly for sleeping and sitting in the middle where it's most Secure. Over all we are very happy!

I was looking for a toddler sized air mattress, but they are so outrageously priced! My 2 yr old outgrew her pack and play, and we travel a decent amount. We don't want her to get used to sleeping in a bed with us, so we were looking for options for her to sleep while we are away from home. I stumbled on this cot and read all the reviews. Some reviewers said the cot tips over if the kid sits on one end; I did not experience this. My kid is about 33 lbs and did not tip the cot over when she was sitting on one end of it. Another reviewer said the cot folded in on the kid and had no locking mechanism. While I agree that there is no locking mechanism, I had no problem with the cot folding in on itself at any point. The cot isn't far from the ground, so I wasn't really worried about her falling off. We did notice that she moved off of it to sleep on the floor the first few nights, but we remedied that once we took away a few stuffed animals and gave her more room on the cot. I did not feel like my child was unsafe at any time. My 2 yr old is about 37 inches tall, and she fits fine on this cot. We only ran into space issues because she likes to have too many stuffed animals on the bed! I expect to be able to use this cot until she's at least 4. Oh and side note, my child still sleeps in a crib at home, and she had no issues adjusting to sleeping on this cot or going back to sleeping in a crib after we returned home. It folds up to the size of a child's camping chair and has a carrying case. It is very light, and we plan on taking this with us on a 3 week trip. We';; either take it as one of our carry-ons or stick it in a checked bag. Oh and there is no "set up" involved. You just pull it out of the bag and open it up like you would a camping chair. This is a great product. I would give this cot 5 stars if the sheet that had come with it actually fit on the cot. It was too small and caused the cot to fold up a lot when I put the sheet on. I just use a crib sheet instead (which I have plenty). The crib sheet is too big but not to where it is a problem or comes off the cot. I attached pictures for reference.

Really Really disappointed by Regalo... We were big supporters of their products but their customer service is horrendous. This cot broke after 1 week of use in a 1 year period. The bold holding the cot together collapsed underneath my 3 year old child. My son is a small 33 pound child, who slept on the cot no more than 5 days in a one year period. The product was defective, and regalo would not replace or refund the product. Really poor customer service here... won't be purchasing from them again!
reviews.review_header: DEFECTIVE PRODUCT- REGALO WOULD NOT REFUND OR REPLACE-

reviews.review_text: I bought a blue Regalo cot at Walmart 2 years ago. It was very comfortable and just great!!! It finally wore out and broke after my daughter used it every weekend for 2 years. Not a big deal, I decided to order a new one from amazon but this time in pink. It'seems awful. The middle part is highly then the rest of the cot. Not only is it very uncomfortable but I would think it would mess up my daughter'so back eventually, and I am definitely not going to let it happen. Returning it right away and seeing if I can find a blue at Walmart again. If not, they I will be looking for another brand.
reviews.review_header: It was very comfortable and just great

reviews.review_text: Thinking about getting a second one. My grandson loves it. He is 4yrs old and weighs 40 pounds. He even lays around on it when he is watching shows on his ipad. He says it's comfortable and he has some room to grow. I bought him a sleeping bag too, but he just laid on top of that too and wanted a blanket. It must be rather comfy, I'm also having a hard time keeping my lab off of it. which is why I intend to buy a second one Thankfully it came with an easily removable and easily washable sheet. Seems to be made to last. So far I have no complaints.
reviews.review_header: Well made and seems to sleep well.

name: 100 Singalong Songs For Kids

reviews.review_text: I am not really a fan of kids music where kids are singing (generally it sounds bad or annoying to me) but this has a lot of great classics that I don't see on other CDs, and it doesn't annoy me like most CDs with kid groups singing (I'm not a scrooge, I swear, I am just picky and want my child to hear the good stuff!). If you want some really excellent children's music, do yourself a favor and check out The Okee Dokee Brothers. You can watch their adventure DVDs on Netflix right now, and their CDs come with the DVDs. Solid and amazing kids music.
reviews.review_header: Some of the better "sung by kids" music that I have heard in a while

reviews.review_text: Best collection of children's favorite songs I have found. From "Found a Peanut" to "Oh My Darling", to "Bones them Bones them Dry Bones", and several old familiar church songs and I am not a churchy person, but I do remember them as a child and I am happy my grandchildren are learning them. They sing sing sing on their own little girl CD player, and I can't think of a better way to spend time together when you are inside on snowy cold days and on rainy days. Going on a car ride? Bring these along, so much better than showing a movie. This said by a teacher of children for over 32 years. What better recommendation is there than that!
reviews.review_header: Best collection of children's favorite songs I have found

reviews.review_text: Great songs on this CD! Get it for your preschool classroom! We loved all the CDs and used them daily. The songs are sung by kids and adults, they are well recorded. Poor Little Pencil: A Happy How-to-Hold the Pencil Book (Rhyming Picture book, Toddlers, Preschool, Kindergarten, Pencil grips, Teaching Pencil Grip, Ages 3-6, Handwriting, OT 1)

Lots of familiar songs on here but some of the lyrics seem to be regionally specific which threw my granddaughter a little off kilter, e.g., the Alphabet Song still ended with "Tell me what you think of me" and what we call "The Itsy bitsy Spider" became a similar variation. (Nothing major, but it doesn't take much to throw them off as any toddler's parent/grandparent can attest to!) There are also several religious songs on the CD which we enjoyed but may not appeal to others. The voices are all those of children which are, for the most part, fairly talented.
reviews.review_header: Mostly songs with a Christian theme

reviews.review_text: Love that there are so many songs that are recognizable but it's a little bit more religious than I thought. For instance there are songs that are clearly biblical on the track (whole world in his hands, who swallowed Jonah, Joseph and the battle of Jericho, etc) but then there are songs you think will be non religious like (if your happy and you know it) and all of a sudden the lyrics are "if your happy and you know it shout Amen" I wasn't a fan of that. I think this CD needs to be re branded as 100 Sing Along Biblical Songs for Kids. That being said there are some classics. (Wheels on the bus, Itsy Bitsy Spider, Do your ears hang low, all around the Mulberry Bush, Alphabet song, etc) and the price is great!

Almost all kids favorite songs are in this collection. I am only giving 4 stars for the following reasons: 1) a good number of songs are not children’s songs but they are religious songs. 2) Recording of some of the songs are not of very good quality.
reviews.review_header: Almost all kids favorite songs are in this collection

reviews.review_text: more or less as advertised; the kids slinging do a fine job but the number of Christian indoctrination gets annoying. If you are part of the 75%of the word that isn't Christian, consider something else...any of the "They might be giants" kids songs, or "ballads from the age of science" will suit you better. Wanted to give 2 stars, but quality is good so that felt too harsh.
reviews.review_header: Quality ok, density of religious content is not for me.

reviews.review_text: Perfect for kids w/ parents who are weary of violent/sex related lyrics & commercials playing on the radio. I didn't realize a lot of songs are Christian songs until we started listing to it which was awesome
reviews.review_header: Everyone w/ kids should buy this! Worth every penny

reviews.review_header: Everyone w/ kids should buy this! Worth every penny

reviews.review_text: What kid wouldn't like to find out that their "boring" parents are really secret spies? That's the premise of this movie and I thought my kids would like it although I'll admit I went knowing that I could stay awake looking at Antonio Banderas (a hunk if there ever was one!). But I was surprisingly entertained and charmed by the entire movie and found the child actors in this one nearly stole the show from Banderas. Unlike so many patronizing or just plain silly kids' movies, this one had wit, heart and a strong plot - and plenty of humor, too. I'm looking forward to owning this one on DVD when it comes out. A movie ilke this could become a family classic.
reviews.review_header: I went to see Antonio Banderas, charmed by entire movie!

reviews.review_text: My daughter loves this movie. The quality is wonderful. The price is great too.

I did not watch the movie but my 7 year old son really liked it. After watching the first spy kids he wanted to watch all four spy kids movie s. It kept him entertained on our flight to and from vacation.
Movie

Light hearted whimsy. Lots of smiles while watching. Good comic acting, original style in directing. Only criticism-- for an adult (me) it went on too long without having a "third act" different enough from the earlier parts to be worth watching.
Favorite around here
Cute movie.
I watched this movie with my 8 year old grandson and I really enjoyed it. The movie kept a fast pace so this kept our interest. Good movie.
Best thing, they are learning things
I didn't order this
I purchased PBS Kids for my grandson. There are many programs to choose from. Many are short enough to keep his attention.
I love this app because my daughter can watch this on her tablet and on the go! She loves Daniel Tiger too!
Great App, grand kids love it, me too, glad my daughter recommended it.
We love this. My baby loves it. Thank you PBS kids. If you don’t have this, what are you waiting for, just get it already!
This is the BEST kids video app there is!
very fun

name: Crayola Inspiration Art Case: 140 Pieces, Art Set, Gifts for Kids, Age 4, 5, 6

reviews.review_text: Great art set ages 3 and up! I bought it as a gift for my granddaughter and she is over the moon thrilled.

Fantastic case as everyone has mentioned. At times this set is listed as $39, and other times as $19. If it is more expensive than $19 or $20, you may want to hold out and see if the price drops over the next few days.
reviews.review_header: Fantastic case as everyone has mentioned

reviews.review_text: I purchased this for my daughter for her 5th birthday recently. This set is absolutely wonderful! There is such a huge selection of beautiful colors with crayons, colored pencils, and markers and of course Crayola always has good quality products. The case is also very pretty and pretty sturdy. She was so excited when she opened it and we have already gotten a lot of use out of it. It is absolutely worth the $25! I think I might even buy one for myself! ***NOTE*** It does NOT come with scissors, despite the description! I even contacted Crayola about this. So, don't expect that to be in your set.

I've bought my two daughters lower quality plastic sets before at craft store-type places and the cost has ranged from $2-5. They always ended up falling apart (I guess that's to be expected at such a cheap price). For Christmas this year, I decided to find a better quality set and I ended up purchasing two of the Crayola Premier Sets. First things first, what you get is what is pictured - the Inspiration Art Set, not the Premiere Set, which has scissors. The case is sturdy and it's packed with the items your child will actually use, NOT things like the useless pastel chalk/crayons or cheap water color paint set like some other sets have. This set has crayons, small colored pencils, pipsqueak markers, regular markers, and sheets of drawing paper. And, of course, it's the Crayola brand quality you know and trust. One thing should be noted...Christmas was less than a week ago and one of the clasps on my 11 year old's Crayola case has already broken and fallen off. I contacted Crayola through their Facebook page and asked how to get a replacement, and they promptly replied requesting the model number and my mailing address. I'm assuming they are sending a replacement, and I will update when I know for sure. This set is nice and will certainly be perfect for any child who likes to draw or color. It may be better suited for a child who is able to take reasonably good care of it. My 10 and 11 year olds seem to enjoy their cases more than anything else they've received for Christmas this year, and that's saying a lot! Edited to add: Crayola contacted me and they are indeed shipping me a new Inspiration Art Set to replace one daughter's breaking case. They gave me the choice between a new set or same-value coupons for other Crayola products, and I chose to receive a new set since both daughters enjoy this set so much. What fantastic customer service!
reviews.review_header: Makes a great gift for kids!

reviews.review_text: I am happy with the quality of the case but was disappointed by the contents. The colors of markers I received are not like the ones in the picture I received mostly blue mini markers, I did not receive a single red or orange mini marker.
reviews.review_header: I am happy with the quality of the case but was disappointed ...

reviews.review_text: The Crayola Color Inspiration Kit is a lightweight fold open case that reveals a wide range of colors across crayons, pencils, and markers, and a lot for any kid pre-K to be creative with color. The bounty of the kit is traditional crayons, coming in at 64 different colors (if my basic math skills don't fail me); but, on top of crayons, there are 20 half-size colored pencils, 20 half-size color markers, and 20 full-size color markers. It even includes a pack of paper - albeit it looks like an instruction manual package with blank instructions and unbound (i.e., finding it was more of an oddity than a necessity; it made me laugh seeing it). The markers are water soluble - I had no trouble wiping away marks that missed the paper. There is no pencil sharpener, but I'd honestly rather my daughter not be playing around with a small razor - so you'll probably need to get one to keep separate. And yes it comes with paper, but if you have no decent art paper or coloring books, you'll likely want to grab that too - in the spirit of the kit, I'd say art paper over coloring books. And a clip board or a 2x4 hardboard with large clips on it can keep the attention and the color on the paper. Overall, for what it comes with and its great price, I would recommend giving it a go. It certainly is aimed at an age group, so if your child is starting to really round out their art and are interested in going further, this won't satisfy. This is a kit for a child to develop an initial expression of interest in art (just beyond the wild scribbling phase).
reviews.review_header: Ordered for my 5yr old daughter - she loves it!

reviews.review_text: Seriously, I buy these art sets as gifts all the time. They are reasonably priced, and are great! No more big containers of broken crayons! No more markers without caps! These sets have little spots for each and every crayon and marker, so my kids actually PUT THEM AWAY. Everything stays organized, and nothing gets lost. We've had one of these cases for over a year, and my kids play with it regularly. I'm a big fan.

name: AmScope 120X-1200X 52-pcs M30-ABS-KT2-W Kids Beginner Microscope Science Kit with Metal Body Microscope, Plastic Slides, LED Light and Carrying Box

reviews.review_text: Great beginner microscope. I suspect that the majority of the low reviews for this microscope are from people that either have little microscope experience or were expecting it to do things it was never designed to do. I have a degree in biology (although I'm not employed in a biological field), so I have plenty of experience using lab quality microscopes. This microscope produces a reasonable level of clarity and magnification. Children will be able to see individual cells, and even nuclei. Yes, it can be a little bit hard to focus at times since there is no fine adjustment, only coarse, and yes, your field of view does move a bit while adjusting it. But again, this is a $40 microscope made for kids. This is more than good enough to introduce your child (or even adults) to the world of microscopy. The kit is great, and will give the user plenty of things to do with the microscope. A few prepared slides, and tools to make some simple slides of your own are included, along with the brine shrimp kit. I was pleasantly surprised by what this microscope can do, and can't wait to give it to my daughter for the holidays (I took it out of the box and tested it first due to some of the bad reviews on here). If you are inexperienced with microscopes, here are a few tips: make sure that what you are trying to view is in the center of the aperture (where the light comes through), and always start on the lowest magnification.
reviews.review_header: Great at what it's designed for

reviews.review_text: I got this for my daughter for Christmas next month. I thought I would give it a try since I saw all these bad reviews. This is an amazing microscope for the price and works really well. I have a history of working with them and found it very easy to find the samples on the slides. They also showed up really nicely. The key it to start with the smallest magnification (300), once you have found your sample and focused on it then attempt using the higher magnifications. Some of the slides are not meant to be seen with the highest magnification. Also be sure to clean all slides before viewing as all of ours had dust on them. It will be harder to see anything with dust on the slide. The eye piece also needed to be cleaned because it was dusty. The microscope is metal, the stage is plastic with plastic clips. I did find it a bit annoying that I could not move the stage from side to side, so when viewing I had to move the slide its self. I have not used the hatchery or any of the other things as I am gifting this in a month. Even without using those items I am very pleased with this product. It was better then I could have imagined. I cant wait to make slides with my daughter and see what we can see. I have included some images I captured of each slide with my camera. These are not as clear as they are when viewing it through the scope with your eyes. However I wanted to show everyone that this microscope does indeed work. I found all of the samples with in a matter of minutes besides the corn root (blue slide with small round circles on it all in rows). The corn root is pale yellow, making it hard to see with the light shining on it. So I used the blue light filter to help bring it out better. I hope this helps you all feel more comfortable about making your decision with this brand. The carrying case is a nice plus too.

Great for the price! Bought it for homeschooling and the kids love it. They are 9, 10, & 11 and can use it without any help. Came with some great extras and has already provided hours of entertainment! Would recommend for any grade school aged children.

I gave this to my 9 year old grandson for his birthday. The look on his face when he opened it said how much he liked it. We spent a lot of times looking at the prepared slides and he and his father were going to make more of their own thanks to the directions that explained how. As a retired teacher, I love the fact that I can give something educational as a present and still see all the joy that it brings. We were all impressed with the microscope and how easy it was to use.

I purchased this microscope kit for my nine-year-old daughter. She wanted "spy supplies," for Christmas, so we got her this kit to go along with other items. She enjoys science, chemistry, and anything possibly related to forensics. This kit is sturdy, and provides plenty magnification for our needs. We've completed a few of the experiments from the kit, and my daughter found those enjoyable. We did purchase extra glass slides from our local arts and crafts store, because my daughter wanted to keep her slide collection and label some of her favorite items. I would recommend this kit for the little scientist in your life.
Got this for Christmas gift and you can't see anything with it. It's cheapy . Very dissapointing
reviews.review_header: Cant see anything with it. Very cheapy

reviews.review_text: This is a really nice Microscope Kit. I purchased this for my 7 year old granddaughter and it's got everything she will need for many years to come. I will say it is a little too advanced for her and she has to have help to use it. Focusing the microscope is something of a challenge and she can't just grab it and look at something, so that was disappointing for her. I think it is very appropriate for an older child, but 7 is just too young. It's way to involved.
reviews.review_header: EXTREMELY WELL DONE, AND WORTH PURCHASING

reviews.review_text: Great quality microscope and materials. Two observations. The small white box with glass slides is difficult to open for a child-- consider redesigning the box latch system. Also, items may shift and pop out of their recesses during shipping despite the insert, so be cautious when opening the case for the first time. Their are enough supplements to this kit to make this a very enjoyable 1st time microscope. My daughter and I had a great time looking at the slides, our own hair and are planning on doing the enclosed brine shrimp this weekend. Also included are blank slides to make your own. The instructions are well laid out and very clear. Looking forward to lots of scientific endeavors with this!

name: Creativity for Kids Origami - Origami for Beginners, 60 Bright Origami Papers

reviews.review_text: This is a nice introduction to origami. There are plenty of origami papers for lots of practice. Very colorful and the instructions are pretty easy to follow. My 7 year old did so e of the easier ones following the instructions on her own. This was a great gift.

After watching Kubo and the Two Strings our 5 year old wanted to try out origami. After looking at several different packs, we went with this one. I am so glad we did! The colorful paper is fun and she loved the stickers. The best part is that they have YouTube videos for each one. That was super helpful because the instructions aren't that easy to understand for newbies to origami. I highly recommend this kit!
reviews.review_header: Great colorful paper and instructional videos on YouTube!

reviews.review_text: It's NOT for kids! My kid is 9 and not frustrated. As an adult, I find it very difficult to follow the directions. They really don't have many written instructions, just some vague pictures. I would not recommend this project for kids under 14. I only gave it 2 stars because the paper is colorful and can be used for other craft projects.
reviews.review_header: NOT a craft for kids under 14 or 15

reviews.review_text: Instructions are difficult for an adult, let alone a child. Challenging

I'm so glad I ordered this! I try to come up with unique & creative gifts for our daughter with Autism... If you have a child who needs to work on fine motor skills or following step by step instructions this Origami kits is fantastic! She had so much fun turning a piece of paper into an animal! Great confidence builder too! She was so excited to show everyone her creation!
reviews.review_header: I'm so glad I ordered this

reviews.review_text: Got this for my kids to have something to do at hospital when I had baby...ages 8 and 5. There were only a couple they could do and even I couldn't figure some out. The directions were a bit confusing but at least it kept them occupied for a bit!

My son and I make the animals together. Some are harder than others. But the faces absolutely make the creatures come to life. I did go out and buy another easy origami book, but this was well worth it. Wish it came with more faces.
I gave it to my 6 year old niece for Christmas and she loved it. . The colors are so bright and the instructions are easy to follow.
reviews.review_header: Great Way to Keep Kids Occupied

name: Creativity for Kids Grow 'n Glow Terrarium - Science Kit for Kids

reviews.review_text: I sent this to a special little girl named Alexa. She just got over a fight with cancer. She loves it !!!! It was delivered 7/08/15 and grew this tall 8 days later. I recommend this to all children as a very special gift.
Fun and educational, but a word to the wise - you only need to use half of the contents so that you can grow the terrarium twice.
reviews.review_header: My son loved watching the plants grow.

reviews.review_text: Purchased for our daughter as an easter gift. Instructions given were poor but not difficult to figure out by looking at the box. Stickers were difficult to remove from sticker sheet. I had to do them so it wasnt as much fun for her. To top it off nothing ever grew! We did it twice since they give you enough to plant two times. Neither time did it work. We were/are very disappointed in something that should have been very fun.

I gave this as a gift for my 7 year old daughter for Christmas. It was SUPER easy to set up right out of the box. It comes with a plastic jar and silver lid with star and moon cut outs on the top for ventilation. It provides everything you will need and everything is nicely packaged and labeled. It was easy: Top soil, blue-ish sand, rocks, top soil again, decorations (it comes with the small bunny and mushroom pictured), and seeds (chia and something else....). We used the little mist bottle that it came with to mist the seeds and in about 24 hours the seeds were already sprouting! Just awesome to watch! And you can decorate the outside of the jar as well, it comes with some cute little decals and glow-in-the-dark mini stars. I would highly recommend this Grow n' Glow Terrarium.

Our Granddaughter was SUPER EXCITED when unwrapping this gift for her 5th Birthday! Her face lit up and she happily exclaimed: "I can catch firefly's!" And then, it was explained to her that it is a garden in a jar that you plant yourself, and it will glow in the dark at night (Stars/Moon stick-on's) and she was over-the-moon with happiness and couldn't wait to get started on planting. She carefully took each item out of it's plastic as she followed the steps her parent's read aloud to her, (and assisted at times) and she put her garden in a jar (Terrarium) together. This is a very good quality of soil, seeds, little stones, and pretty decorations. It even comes with a little plastic molded rabbit and toadstool which our granddaughter was thrilled to place in her newly planted garden! We can't wait to hear from her on how her garden is growing which should be within a week's time according to the box description. We highly recommend this kit, and will look for other similar kits for future purchase.
reviews.review_header: A delightful kit for your little gardener!

reviews.review_text: I bought this for my five-year-old little brother and he was so smitten with this gift! He loves nature and loved putting this together himself. The instructions were easy to follow and it didn't take too long to put together. Maybe 10-15 minutes. In the weeks following he was happy he had a "job" to do as he had to water the terrarium daily with the special spray bottle included. The different plants popped up in about 2-3 weeks. Very cool!
reviews.review_header: Great gift for kids who love nature

reviews.review_text: Bought these as a birthday present for my great grand daughters 5 and 6. They loved it. They were so excited when they put the soil ingredients in -planted the seeds and watered them and watched the terrariums in anticipation. They expected them to start growing immediately. That would have been something for the Guinness World Records. I explained the growth cycle to them, we put them in a window where they would get some sunshine and lo and behold they started seeing some sprouts. They were so excited! My guess would be that they checked on the terrariums at least a dozen times a day. But in the meantime they learned so much. Wonderful experience for all of us. The plants/grass grew so tall they were growing out of the top of the terrarium.
reviews.review_header: My great grand kids loved it

reviews.review_text: My 6 year old daughter loved this! I was worried it wouldn't grow cause after a week, nothing. Then she dumped it over. I assumed it was a goner by then, but I watered it anyways. Another week goes by and I realize there's growth! This is about 2 1/2 weeks after planting. We also did not use the grow light. Just food ol'natural sun on the windowsill.

name: 4M Crystal Growing Experiment

reviews.review_text: My 6 year old son loved this! He took his crystals to school for show and tell. He has them on his dresser now. He and I followed the directions perfectly and they grew like you see on the outside of the box. It was real fun watching them grow daily. Two very important things! 1. When they start growing on the edge of the container and outside (and they will) they will drip on the surface. I had a paper towel under mine and it went through the paper towel on the window sill and is impossible to remove without repainting! 2. If they get dusty do not put under water! Its like pouring hot water on ice cream. They crystal will wash away. (odd the crystal does that but the stain from the crystal is like titanium !) Hope that helps! ray333ray2001@yahoo.com

This set is AWESOME! I highly recommend it! I purchased it to grow crystals in the office as a fun experiment to keep me entertained during busy season and it did not disappoint. You need to be sure to follow the instructions carefully. I made a fatal error on my first attempt and did not wait the full 30 minutes before I added the crystal seeding and nothing ended up growing. On the subsequent attempts I followed the instructions to a T and was able to grow beautiful crystals. I even ordered a second set because the results were astounding. The steps are simple enough I was able to grow these in my office with ease. All you need is boiling water and the rest is provided in the kit. The first step is to dissolve the crystal mixture (it looks almost like sugar) into hot water. Next, you have to let it sit for 15 minutes, and then transfer it into a clear plastic container where the crystal will grow. WAIT ANOTHER 30 MINUTES after the water is transferred. This step is crucial otherwise the crystals will not grow. Once you have waited the allotted time you drop in the crystal seeds. They provide blue, red, and white crystals so you can mix and match them to create different colored crystals. It seems that each type of crystal seed grows a different shape of crystal. I noticed that the red crystal seeds will grow more block-like crystals whereas the blue seeds will create more sharp/pointy crystals that flower out. Blue and red will create a crystal that looks like a combination between the two - it flowers out but is more block-like. Keep this in mind when you choose the colors you make. You will start seeing growth overnight. Its amazing to watch the progress. On the instructions it says it takes 4-7 days before the crystals are fully grown. I would keep an eye on them and drain the water when the crystal is about to emerge from the water. If you leave it too long the crystal is exposed to the air it will form "snow-like" growths on the top (which I think are ugly). The rate of growth will be affected by the temperature of the room as well as the size of the crystal you are growing. The crystals grow well in warmer temperatures. The small crystals will finish growing faster than the large ones. Each bag of crystal mixture can either make 1 large one, 2 medium sized one, or 4 small ones. The kit allows you to grow 1 large crystal, 2 medium crystals, and 4 small crystals simultaneously because that is the amount of containers they provide. If you want to grow 3 large ones you can grow them one at a time because they only provide one large container. I think the large crystals are the coolest.All in all this is an amazing kit. Everyone in the office is jealous and now they want to grow their own crystals too. 5 stars!!! I want to make ALL the crystals!
reviews.review_header: This set is AWESOME! I highly recommend it

reviews.review_text: I bought this set of crystals because it was the same brand as a previous crystal kit I had bought with tickets at an arcade. The first kit was awesome so I decided to give this a try. This kit says you can make 7 individual crystals. You can't make 7 big crystals, but you can make 1 big, 2 medium, and 4 small (OR you could make 3 big only. It is based on how much crystal seeding and powder they start you with) It says the colors are assorted but I'm willing to bet that every kit comes with 1 pack of white, 1 pack of blue, and 1 pack of red. The kit encourages you to mix red and blue to make purple and mix the blue or red with white to make pink or light blue. The image I have attached is what color you get when you mix red and white. I think the reason some folks have trouble making these crystals grow is because they aren't following the directions exactly. I use filtered tap water that I measure and pour out of my brita. I heat the water on my stove in a pot. I stir in the bag of powder until it is all dissolved. I wait until it cools to add the seeding mixture (this set has you transfer the crystals from an opaque cup to a clear display cup for growing so you can make multiple at a time. I recommend this because the display cups are easier to see through, however, when you transfer the liquid you MUST wait 30 minutes for the contents to settle before you add the seeding crystals) Then once you sprinkle them on, don't stir or bump the container. You gotta let it sit for about a week before your crystals are fully developed. I usually wait until the tip of the highest crystal is about to peek out of the surface of the water. I display my crystals on my windowsill in my kitchen instead of in the plastic display containers. I don't have kids though, so I'm not worried about them breaking or anything. Anyway, I love watching these crystals grow. They're hard enough to handle gently and observe, but some of the smaller crystals are fragile and can snap off. I wanted something that would make crystals for displaying and that is what I got! For $14 this was an awesome deal for me. The instructions were clear and concise and I'd totally buy it again (but then I'd have so many crystals my husband would start to worry!)

name: Retevis RT628 Kids Walkie Talkies 22 Channel FRS Toy for Kids Uhf FRS 2 Way Radio Toy(Red, 2 Pack)

reviews.review_text: Oh, man, I love these Retevis RT628 Walkie Talkies!! (OVER) I would have loved to have them as a kid! (OVER) My 4-year-old daughter and I run around the house talking through these without any interference or static (OVER) "Daddy, why do you keep saying 'over' when you talk to me?" Because they are walkie-talkies!!! "Roger that, daddy!!" They are very easy to use, great size for small hands and clear. I've been a little less than a 1/4 mile away with no drop in signal or voice (other than when my daughter forgets to push the button to talk). The handsets have a few buttons to adjust sound or change frequency and some menu items, but for straight walkie-talkie'ing, just power on and press the talk button. (and let go to listen to the other person). The one thing I don't like is there is a little 'chirp' sound like the old Motorola/Nextel 'push-to-talk' features. My daughter likes it, but she is 4 and has no concept of stealth. She uses it when she is two feet away (I CAN HEAR YOU WITHOUT THE WALKIE-TALKIE, SWEETY!!) Anyway - these are a lot of fun and seem very professional with sound clarity and distance for the price. Easy enough for a 4 year old to use too (OVER)
reviews.review_header: Walkie-Talkies like you wish you had as a kid!

reviews.review_text: I let my neighbor's kids tried it out. I had listen to them, the modulation is very loud without so much of mushy sound. Remember, loud audio will cut through popping noise during the weak signal. The range throughout the neighborhood to dozen of blocks away, still very readable copy. No monthly service fees. Rechargeable AA batteries work very well. Remember; this walkie talkies is beyond toy level in performance and range. The range is depended on: Line -of- sight or blockage do to hills, trees and housing in the way to shorten the range. From high hill top that over look in long way for eyes sight can see, your range can reach well more than 10 air miles away. As of standard line of sight over the flat open land, your range will able to reach from 2 to 3 miles. In resident area, your range will average from 1/2 to 3/4 mile, up to 1 mile.
reviews.review_header: Chinese Version of Motorola Quality Plus Performance

reviews.review_text: Bought this for both myself and my five year old. I had previously picked him up some cheaper made walkies from Toys R Us. They were pretty quick to break. After researching products I found these. They are durable and made for kids. In the months we have had them he has dropped them, banged them (running around) and even gotten them slightly wet…..but they are still going strong. I am using rechargeable batteries for them right now since they seem to drain the batteries fairly fast.

After an initial problem with one cutting out, customer service reached out to me and was very responsive to my concerns. They sent me a replacement at no cost and now they work great. No issues at all. Kids absolutely love them. There are a few buttons on there that confuse the kids but once they get the hang of it, they work really, really well. The walkie talkies also have a great range. I am able to talk to my kids that are across the street while I'm inside the house and still have very clear signal. Very satisfied with my order now. Would recommend!
reviews.review_header: After help from customer service, would recommend!

reviews.review_text: When you look at the price of these walky-talkies you might think they are made as toys for children. But when you hold it in your hand it doesn’t feel like a toy. They are well made and feel solid and durable. The buttons work well, voices are clear, and the range is at least half a mile and probably more under good conditions. So why do I give them only four stars? The reason is the miserable instructions. I think the included leaflet of instructions for the user was written to cover many models by the same manufacturer, because some of the instructions are wrong and some don’t make sense. The units have some features that I can’t use because I don’t know how. For example, the squelch is probably adjustable but I don’t know how to do that. The result is to make me feel stupid. Let me end this review before I decide to take two stars off.

I got these for my 11-year-old nephew, and it was such a fun present! He opened them immediately and played with them non-stop for the better part of the afternoon. I think these are bound to amuse and entertain kids of almost any age, and most adults too. The charging base takes three AA batteries. The quality of these is fantastic, and I believe they will last for a long time without breaking. They are small, and can easily fit in your pocket. Besides using them for playtime, I could see the benefit of these for actual walkie talkie use as well, say for a camping trip, or to keep in touch at a theme park. I read other reviews claiming the range of these walkie talkies is about a mile and a half to two miles, and I think that's accurate. We didn't take them quite that far yet, but we had no problems with crackling or speaking with clarity. Makes a great gift!
reviews.review_header: No problems with crackling or speaking with clarity!

reviews.review_text: Oh my gosh...we gave these walkie talkies to our now 6 year old grandson at a family birthday get together for the February birthdays...and we didn't see half of the family for over an hour 1/2. They had so much fun with them!!! And I am talking young and old!!! Love them!!! great range, great audio.....great size!

My son wanted "Spy Gear" radios for his birthday and after buying them and not being able to talk to each other from 20 feet away, we returned them and bought these for $4 more. These are great!! they are clear, easy to use and have a good range on them. They are as good as mine that I paid $75 for. They seem to be really good on battery life a well. My son and his friends used them quite a bit and we have only changed the batteries once in 3 months.
reviews.review_header: These are great!! they are clear

name: Click N' Play Gigantic Keyboard Play Mat, 24 Keys Piano Mat, 8 Selectable Musical Instruments + Play -Record -Playback -Demo-mode

reviews.review_text: Bought this for my twin granddaughters who are 2. This piano has awesome sound, is pretty big, so both girls can be on it at the same time. My only wish would be that the volume control were concealed or to be able to 'lock' the volume at a certain decibel. These girls want it LOUD and gMa needs it a little quiet sometimes. It does seem durable though and they really like it alot. (I know, they are a little young for it but, I wanted to instill music early!.}
reviews.review_header: A hidden volume button might be nice!

reviews.review_text: The only reason this doesn't get a full 5 star rating is because the volume is ridiculous. I'm not a fuddy-duddy when it comes to things that make noise, and my kids love all things music, so I thought this mat would be a hit. However, even my twin two year olds say it can get too loud right after they turn it on. The volume control works well, and has to be the very first thing adjusted when it is turned on, the kicker is when the sound box goes into sleep mode if left on and unattended for only about 15 mins, the volume defaults to the loudest setting when woken up again. This can be a little startling when they step on it again. Other than the wonky sound settings, this is sturdy, plays well and is a lot of fun! I would still recommend this piano mat over the other options.
The mat does not work anymore and we have sparingly used it. Not reliable.
reviews.review_header: Not Reliable, Does not work any more, sparingly used and broke in one month

reviews.review_text: Great gift for my nephews, 1 year and 5 years. Fits the bill as something that's advanced enough for a 5 year old but doesn't have small parts that the baby could choke on. Fun for adults too! Withstood being packed up and unpacked and taken outside. Notes are not accurate (to be expected) but relative they are fine.

Got this for our 2 year old nephew for the holidays. So far we hear that he is obsessed with it, and while it may drive the parents a little crazy, it is worth it seeing his face light up when he gets to play with it. The fact that it's musical and has a large age-range of who would enjoy playing with it was a huge selling point. Great quality, no issues, many hours of entertainment, and the fact that you can record the music and play it back after is awesome.

Keys continue to stop working. Lasted about 3 weeks of very sparring use and the 1 key at a time just stops working. Now less than 6 months down the road nearly 1/2 of the keys don't work. Used by young adults not kids, so this is absolutely not a quality product.

I bought this for my niece after she watched the movie 'Big' for the first time. LOL. It is a nice size, not too big, not to small. My niece LOVES it. It allows you to play the demo, record what you play, and change the sounds of the keys to different types of instruments. My 10 month old loved rolling on the keys. It seems really durable and well made. Great fun for a great price.

works on my medium loop carpet; thicker carpet might be an issue. It's 1 1/2 octaves. Only little feet can play the black notes; adult feet fit on the white notes. Surface is very slick; stocking feet not recommended. Using a underlayment pad for rug to carpeting helped with the mat slipping. Preset volume level is extremely loud; you have to turn it down every time. Demo method is not relevant for me. Don't know how long the batteries will last.
reviews.review_header: stocking feet not recommended. Using a underlayment pad for rug to carpeting ...

name: NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC - Break Open 10 Geodes – TOP QUALITY!

reviews.review_text: Let me start off with what I liked about this: I have sampled a few other geode-breaking brands and a lot of them were very hard to crack. Usually ones that are harder to crack are mostly rock and less cavelike crystal space. Only one of the rocks in this lot was hard to break, and that was because it was completely solid crystal. I'm not too upset about it because that's just the nature of geodes- sometimes you get a rock. 9/10 geodes is good enough for me. Now, a problem is that even though there were many decent sized geodes, there were two that were pretty small. One was extremely small and seemed to have been under 1.5 inches in diameter. Another thing is that about 6 of them were the same type of rock and looked exactly the same inside. I wasn't expecting a hand-picked assortment, but when over half of them are the same rock despite the varieties that exist, it seems a bit odd. Maybe I just got a bad lot. But even still, the quality and overall easy-opening of these geodes compared to the other brands I've bought will keep me coming back for more every time I decide to start a new craft project.
reviews.review_header: Not perfect, but will be buying again

reviews.review_text: Purchased the geodes for my 7 year old's birthday. She absolutely loved breaking them open, but I was pretty excited about it too! We opened a few at a time and let the whole family and a few friends open one. I guess we got lucky and all of the rocks were actual geodes... no duds. Only one of the rocks was somewhat solid, but it still was filled with crystals. There were two different types of geodes in the kit. All of the crystals were either white or light gray-purple-ish. Very pleasantly surprised and pleased!

These geodes are natural, not a manufactured product (and not cement as another reviewer claimed), so expect some variation. Because they are real, no one can look inside ahead of time and make sure all ten geodes will be spectacular when opened. I didn't get any with beautiful colored crystals inside, but most were hollow with interesting crystals. Only one was not quite hollow, but it had a swirl of pale blue agate inside of it, so we were pleased. My thirteen year old son and I used a regular old claw hammer and had no trouble opening any of them, although read the instructions carefully!! Some of them are actually pretty fragile and will dissolve into a pile of sand if you whack too hard to start. We also used a chisel with some of them to try to achieve an even split, as the instructions suggested. We did this outside on the pavement as it does make a small mess (easily swept away). I am only giving four stars instead of five because unless you have a portable vice (or are willing to pound geodes in your workshop), one person does have to hold the geode (and chisel) in place while the other person swings the hammer. It's inherently hazardous. I was the "holder" while my son wielded the hammer. Luckily, I still have all my fingers and some nice geodes to boot.
reviews.review_header: Natural geodes so expect some variation

reviews.review_text: I ordered this along with another company's pack of geodes for a homeschool science lab.There was no comparison!This pack had HUGE geodes that were amazingly beautiful when the children broke them open.
